reviews.text: Took my girl here a couple weeks ago, and had a wonderful time. Make sure to make a reservation, as the wait time is close to an hour each time! Beautiful date night ambiance.

I got the tacos.  Four petite small ones with rice and beans. It was very filling I couldn&#39;t finish it all. I ate all my fish tacos though <br><br>I ate the beet and avocado salad first with a yogurt dressing   I really enjoyed the creamy texture <br><br>We sat in the outdoor seating area by the fire  it had a great atmosphere <br>I enjoyed the warmth on this chilly evening <br><br>They actually served  us a lot of food <br>In fact it was so much we were so full we couldn&#39;t  eat dessert <br>So we didn&#39;t order <br>And I had wanted to try one of the cheesecakes <br><br>Next time I think my friend and I will order a meal and split it. Then we will be able to order dessert which we can split also

The food was good just didn&#39;t like the fact that it was Lil bugs was flying around. It&#39;s covid going on and I guess I just got a little frantic! Manager never made it to your table to even hear your concern! But oh well just went their because a relative of mine likes it. Other than that they can miss me!

Not the best visit at this location.   Trust me, I am a fan of this restaurant chain, but this time the service was mediocre.  I order a grilled chicken salad with extra tomato.  Got a grilled chicken salad with no tomatoes.  I splurging by eating carbs, but it was<br>an absolute waste on the like warm, bottom-of-the-bag fries.  I&#39;m gonna need this location to try again!  One bad visit doesn&#39;t mean I won&#39;t be back, but this location needs to do better. <br><br>* and the sandwich was very bland tasting....

I had such a wonderful time yesterday. <br><br>I made a reservation for 6pm after my massage and I was early. They still sat us down in an intimate area where it was less people and noise so I can hear who I was with! We started with drinks and I got the passion fruit martini which was a fruity good strong and pretty!  Our server was really nice. She didn&#39;t do anything that was a wow for me but bringing me things to not complain about was enough for me!  <br>I then ordered salmon and shrimp scampi. I don&#39;t understand why I never ate salmon before but since I am planning to move over to pescatarian. I needed to start eating seafood more and I wasn&#39;t disappointed! The scampi sauce was great but it tasted strangely better the next day warmed up. <br>The person I was with had the steak Diane and shrimp<br>scampi. The steak was medium and so good and full of flavor! <br>Of course I didn&#39;t have room for cheesecake but I took it home.  The Cinnabon cheesecake! Omg!!!!! I may have to just forget about going to Cinnabon and just come here! It was soooo close to tasting like the actual Cinnabon but with a hint of cheesecake! <br>Needless to say this will be the first of many times I will be here. I was very pleased and have no complaints.<br>Great date night and you can walk to the movies or ice skate after.

One of my favorite places to eat at once in a while. The fried calamari appetizer was good even w/ the garlic dip that came w/ it. I ordered a shrimp scampi and I mostly taste the sauce in it when I take bites of the shrimp and when I&#39;m at the bottom half of the angel hair pasta. Their celebration cheesecake tasted mostly like a birthday cake w/ a slight cream cheese taste to it since there is cream cheese frosting on it too. Also for their Arnold Palmer (lemonade iced tea) drink it&#39;s like an ombre w/ lemonade at the bottom and tea at the top and after trying to mix the drink it tasted a little better. Hope to be back here soon. :)

I am low key obsessed with this chain but I haven&#39;t been in so long, so tonight was a treat! <br><br>First off, when we walked in, we were greeted promptly by this very nice woman at the gift card station. We were told that it&#39;ll be a 25 minute wait but were seated in less than 5!<br><br>Food/Drink- Started with the buffalo bites (no photos- sorry!) and those were basically fried chicken balls with a side of buffalo sauce and blue cheese. They were HUGE. Honestly, they could have been a meal. Between two people, we still had 4 pieces left. You also get a thing of bread while you wait for your entree (pumpernickel &amp; white). I also had the crispy chicken costoletta. It was really good and was bursting with flavor. The only thing I would change was the amount of sauce you get. The sauce amount is very minimal and I feel like it really adds to the flavor, so I&#39;d recommend just asking for extra. The chicken was thin, a crispy golden brown and had the perfect texture. The mashed potatoes were creamy, flavorful and still had the skins, which I LOVE. For dessert, dun dun dun... I had the celebration cheesecake and my oh my was it good! It&#39;s celebration cake with a layer of cheesecake in the middle and cake crumbs on the outside. It tasted like a higher class birthday cake + cheesecake! It was delicious and a perfect way to end my meal. For my drink, I had the guava daiquiri and that was good as well. Nice and fruity, fresh and a tangy all in one. <br><br>Ambiance/Service- The inside is really nice with tile flooring and pretty decor. The only thing I don&#39;t like about the inside is the lighting. It&#39;s very yellow and quit unflattering but I guess it&#39;s what makes it unique. What really stood out was the service. Our waiter was AMAZING. He was so nice, knowledgeable and he didn&#39;t seem to huff and puff when we asked questions or even when we asked the &#34;which one would you choose&#34; question. Even though it was busy, he gave us his undivided attention the whole time. He was prompt, came to check on us and seemed all around like a kind person and that he really cares. Even the woman who brought us our food was nice. I think this is what sets other restaurants apart honestly. <br><br>All in all, GREAT experience and I can&#39;t wait to come back!

Food is always delicious and our server Gyro was awesome!!!  Must try the Louisiana Cajun Chicken pasta.  Outstanding!  Atmosphere was clean and they do social distancing well.  Always have a problem with their front greeters and hostesses.  They all have an attitude and condescending.  Other than that, it was great.

I haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in probably over 2 years. I received a phone call from a colleague at 11am asking me to meet him for lunch here. I agreed and instantly know what I was going to order... what I always order whenever I visit. We were seated immediately and our bread basket followed shortly after. The Hibachi Steak with Wasabi mashed potatoes! Yummm ... The steak and sause was as delicious as I remember it and the mashed potatoes were so creamy! I subbed my asparagus side for spinach. The manager came by to greet us and even offered us both a complementary slice! I opted for the pineapple upside down cheesecake. Soooooooo delicious!
If you come here you&#39;re asking to get covid, i can&#39;t believe what i just saw. No social distancing whatsoever and overly crowded. Do not come here

I visited this location thinking the food, customer service and overall experience would be just as good as the other locations I have been to in the Houston area. Unfortunately, I was wrong! I hate it when I&#39;m wrong.<br><br>From the time I stepped foot in the door until the time that I left this place it was a complete disaster. Upon my arrival (Tues. Mar. 19 at approximately 2:45 p.m.) I was NOT greeted by, spoken to or ever acknowledged by the hostess. This was a girl with black hair, light brown skin (maybe Latina) and a horrible attitude. &#34;WHERE DO YOU WANNA SIT?&#34; She was not in a good mood and it showed. Since it was a nice day, we got seated on the patio area and when a waitress finally came she said &#34;you cannot sit out here with a stroller due to fire code. The hostess knows this.&#34; Ok, so the visit is starting to go downhill at this point!<br><br>The waitress took me, my twins and our stroller to another section and said &#34;your waiter will be here to check on you in a minute.&#34; During the time I was waiting for 15 minutes, every waiter that walked by said &#34;has someone helped you?&#34; And they still didn&#39;t get me any help!! Finally, someone shows and she brings out bread and I order my food. As soon as I touched the bread, I began to get upset! It was hard as a brick. When she comes back I say &#34;the bread is so hard&#34; and she replies &#34;I knooowww&#34; I then say, &#34;well why did you give it to me?&#34; and she says &#34;that&#39;s all we had.&#34; At this point I am irritated and ready to go. Why would you serve your customer something that YOU probably would not eat? It was rude and inconsiderate to say the least.<br><br>Finally my food comes out and thankfully she brings out fresh bread after my disapproval. . .my food was great and I really wish the service matched. I highly recommend that you spend your time and money elsewhere. This location needs a makeover. I&#39;ll never visit again!

So disappointed. Made reservations to celebrate twin&#39;s birthday. Arrived and were immediately shocked at how busy and crowded restaurant was. We were guided passed many patrons at very close range. Once seated we were never greeted by a server. After 10 minutes we left. Not only were we uncomfortable with the over capacity of patrons and close proximity of an extremely full restaurant, we were never served. My daughter&#39;s never got their reserved birthday dinner celebration. Extremely disappointed.
This is the only location I come to in Houston Alex is a wonderful bartender he show me &amp; my wife a wonderful service every single time
The hosteests in the front are always rude and anti-social. The meatloaf was awful, and our waiter is always uncomfortably close to us, even too close if this was before COVID.

We had a reservation for 8pm and went shopping in the meantime. They called us in a little early only to make us wait once we got there, which really annoyed me. <br>Service is really well done (although the kitchen made a couple of order mistakes). Our server was friendly and pretty attentive.<br>I am really not a fan of the Louisiana pasta I got. The noodles were not really that well sauces and did not keep the heat well except in the center. I was basically eating cold pepper noodles. The chicken was very thin and breaded and had no flavor... not even salt... I would not get this again. I just kept thinking to myself what on earth is making this dish 2100 calories?! I am sad and still hungry because I stopped eating it.<br>Only giving 3 stars bc server was great.

Waited for a table for a large party for over an hour so I called and was told that the wait would be an additional 30-45 minutes. Management never once approached our group to let us know what the status was. No one offered us water or anything. It&#39;s hot as H-E-double-hockey sticks in here and I&#39;m soooo irritated at the customer service. Luckily I&#39;m here for a friend&#39;s celebration dinner or else I woulda been walked out. <br><br>-----------------------------<br><br>August 2019 Review <br><br>The service here is still terrible. I&#39;ve visited twice in the past couple months to only buy a slice of cheesecake only to end up leaving empty handed both times. Last night I stood there for several minutes as people cleaned the Cheesecake window but no one acknowledged me. A man who appeared to be the manager was with the young ladies as they cleaned the area and he didn&#39;t acknowledge me either. I asked a server who was nearby if someone would be willing to take my order and she told me someone would be able to help me shortly but after about 3 more minutes, I just left because I was so annoyed. I&#39;d like to point out that there was no line and there wasn&#39;t a rush in the restaurant.

I haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory in awhile and I just say that today was no shorter than amazing. Happy Hour is from 3pm-6pm Monday-Friday. I love their HH menu, because it has so many great options, large portion sizes, very reasonably priced and amazing libations! We had some great bartenders Sam and (not sure the other guys name, but he wears glasses and has the best sense of humor and personality out of this world. They both need a raise! Excellent Customer Service-- He makes the BEST Cosmos!) ..Everything is $6.95 for Happy Hour! Well maybe everything, the dynamite shrimp were $8.95. They are the reason for the minus one star! The serving size was small and over battered. I would not get those again, however I have some HH recommendations below! <br><br>--Happy Hour Recommendations<br>1. Cosmos ! You can&#39;t go wrong for a drink! They are not shabby on the alcohol either and it&#39;s not watered down. I had 3!  <br>2. The Mojitos are pretty minty if that is your cup of tea. I like Mint! So very refreshing! <br>2. The Tex-Mex Eggrolls- They are not Chili&#39;s, but BETTER! Great flavor and lots of them! Shareable! <br>3. Chicken sliders- Totally beats Popeyes chicken sandwiches anyways and they don&#39;t run out. Lol <br>4. The Potstickers- To die for! My next best go to outside of P.F. Chang&#39;s! <br>5. And of course, you have to eat cheesecake or grab one to go! My favs is the Red Velvet, Key Lomé, Oreo, Caramel and Original with Strawberry! <br><br>--Not So Happy Recommendations<br>1. The JW Pink Lemonade.. It was ok, kind of sweeter than I would like. <br>2. The Hot Spinach Dip was a little extra oily than normal. <br>3. The Dynamite Shrimp I could have missed. <br><br>Now I know that is a lot, but it&#39;s Happy Hour! Plus the food critics will be great, because it was a mystery dining experience!  And it&#39;s always great when you are sharing with friends! Enjoy your visit!

Good foods there actually it was much better than I thought. Ordered ribeye, filet and all that I was not expecting much of steak cooking and quality but they were really good to perfection (ordered as medium rare...). It always come across to Front if the house service area. Unfortunately the server was not as good as food. No attention, became suddenly lot friendly once she found we ordered higher price items compared to her initial greeting (you know exactly what I mean).. this sorry 3 stars but will be back for sure!
Service was cool, went there for my mother&#39;s birthday. I didn&#39;t really enjoy my food cuz it was a bit cold but everyone else seemed to enjoy theirs.

Whole lot of nope tonight. It&#39;s busy so I get the long wait to sit but the wait to get our food was ridiculous yes it&#39;s busy so not unexpected but what is unacceptable is subpar food. Appetizer came cold and truffle honey chicken was charred to a crisp and dry af! Just by looking at it I knew it was over cooked but I was starving I really didn&#39;t want to wait for the to fix it so I just ate what I could. Not the first time this location has given us subpar food. Highly doubt I&#39;ll come back to this location even if it is the closest to me. Server was fine no complaints about him none of this was in his control

This place was  perfect.  I was in the mall and decided the get me a piece oF cheese cake.  I did not realize that hey har a variety of cheese cakes.  But,  when I got home it was soooooo gOod.  The service was really great.  The wait was long, but hey it was worth the waiT and the time.  I will be back again.

Stopped by the Cheesecake Factory after viewing the fireworks in memorial city. I&#39;ve reviewed the one in the Galleria, but I would like to give my point of view on this rest as well. This restaurant is located walking distant from the memorial city  mall, so you can&#39;t miss it. <br><br>To begin the review, I will start at the very moment we entered. We were greeted by a nice young lady as soon as we entered. The lady asked how many and then walked us to our seats. The environment of the restaurant is relax, chill, and romantic (pretty much like the others). This is a low light restaurant, so it definitely gives the romantic appeal. It can be a date spot, but a celebration (graduation, etc) spot as well. There&#39;s a bar, booths, and tables, depending on your choice. Our waiter was nice and frequently checked on us. I honestly have no complaints about the quality of service.<br><br>Next, I ended up ordering the chipotle paste, which has a variety of ingredients such that I can&#39;t remember. I&#39;m giving this 4star review because of the pasta. It was flavorful, but too flavorful. The many ingredients did not blend together. Btw, it was a little spicy, but enough for a woman to handle. But if I return, I would not order this pasta. I then ordered a strawberry cheesecake (as always) that was extremely great (as always). <br><br>Everything was nice about the restaurant and I would recommend to friends. You just have to try dishes to find one you really like. Great place to visit in Houston though!

Do yourself a favor and take yourself to an actual Italian restaurant. Better yet go to McDonald&#39;s. You&#39;ll get fresh food and better service there. Cheesecake factory is the knock off brand of Italian food. to the people who gave it more than one stare, where are your taste buds?<br><br>Update: chicken Parmesan not cooked, pasta is watered down. Tell your chefs to take their thumb out of their butt bc that&#39;s not how you check the temp. I&#39;m over this chain, needs to be shut down.

Came about an hour before closing. Surprisingly, the customer service was still good and I didn&#39;t feel rushed. Sat at the bar and ordered the Whiskey Paradise Punch to drink and to eat I had the grilled chicken with mushrooms and other veggies and pasta in a white wine sauce. Both were really good!

Went for dinner and it was a nice experience. Nicole P. Was our server tonight and she was amazing, very attentive and our order was correct. Our appetizer came out quick and the wings are absolutely delicious!! My boyfriend had the bacon burger and I had the grilled steak tacos and they were so good, although the rice and beans needed salt but over all it was delicious. We also had a couple drinks which were yummy, we will definitely be coming back.

If it weren&#39;t for my father&#39;s love of their Georgia Peach drink, I wouldn&#39;t come. <br><br>Do they have happy hour? Yes. You must be willing to sit only in the bar area or outside (in disgusting Houston November humidity which is a special kind of disgusting hell). If you are short, like me, sitting at high tables is ridiculously problematic albeit entertaining for others to watch as you need a running start to get up into those chairs. Despite this grievance, the manager made it perfectly clear that my wish as a customer was irrelevant to her life. I found myself admiring her tenacity and resolve to ensure that Happy Hour was indeed restricted to the bar area: only. After all, we all know that the customer is never right and should shove it. Absurd. Not to mention that as I waited, another customer had to ask the manager if service was actually operating in the aforementioned Hell perched outdoor area. <br><br>Alas, here I sit. Waiting. Damn your Georgia Peaches, Cheesecake Factory, and the spell you&#39;ve cast over my father.<br><br>Update: dirty glass of wine. Asked for a new glass. Wine from dirty glass poured directly into new glass. I had the audacity to send it back and ask for fresh wine out of the bottle. For shame.

My entire experience here Friday night was a complete nightmare. Upon arrival the hostess was rude and did not acknowledge me when I was standing right in front of her, it was almost as if I was bothering her when I asked her about picking up my food. I stood in line for 25 minutes and was skipped three times while trying to pick up food I ordered ahead of time I could see my order with my name on the counter the entire time while waiting. I was skipped by three different customers I do understand that fridays are busy but I do believe this establishment should implement a pick up only line.. and not have people who want cheesecake and pick up orders on the same line. When I got home I only live 6 minutes from the restaurant my food was cold and the bread was rock hard.. I honestly didn&#39;t even want it anymore. I was overall very dissatisfied with my visit here and disappointed because the truffle honey chicken is probably my top 3 favorite item to eat out.

There was only talk of coronavirus protection. Their menus were filthy! Sticky, gritty, visible dried funk on most pages. We had to ask for table to be sterilized after we saw patrons leaving the table at which they sat us. Server told us they were only required to sterilize table in the morning, but he did at our insistence. Tables marked as unavailable near us were seated with large, unmasked parties.

Nathan was our server and he did an amazing job! He had the answers to all of our questions, and was very timely in getting everything out to us. Being a waiter can be stressful, but Nathan took it in stride. We can&#39;t wait to be back and have Nathan take care of us!

This was  the first time in a long time dining at Cheesecake Factory. Boy, we regretted it so bad. <br><br>First, the service used to be good there. Not anymore. It felt more like, &#34;welcome to Mc Donald&#39;s, May I take your order?&#34; If you know what I mean. <br><br>They ran out of Jamaican chicken at 6 pm?!!! What a chain restaurant! The rest of the food we ordered was just ok.  And it took 55 minutes for us to get our food. Totally not acceptable. <br><br>Last, we bought a cheesecake to go after dinner. <br>We used to love their strawberry cheesecake. Guess what? The strawberries on the cheesecake  still tasted FROZEN after one day in the fridge!!!! I&#39;m not sure what they have added too the strawberries to make it taste that way. YUCK!

On my last visit a year ago I found broken glass in my mouth while chewing the Bellagio. I decided to give them another try. This time the meal was absolutely delicious, no broken glass! The spaghetti was a bit rubbery. Other than that it was well-worth the visit. Well done!

Literally the WORST Cheesecake Factory location I have ever been to. There was a long wait time to be seated, but that was expected as it was a Saturday night. The trouble started AFTER we were seated. First of all, it took the waitress 45 mins just to bring out bread and drinks out. After she had brought it out, she never asked us if we wanted a refill on drinks throughout the entire course of our dinner. <br><br>Our food came out 50 minutes after our drinks. 1.5 hours to get served your meal is just unacceptable. When the food came out, it was COLD! I had gotten the 4 cheese pasta, and it didn&#39;t even taste like it was freshly made. Also, my plate wasn&#39;t even full. They give a much larger portion at the Woodlands location. <br><br>At the end of the night, the waitress charged me $5 for my drink, when it was really supposed to be $3.50. She went to go change my ticket only AFTER showing me attitude first. Horrible food, horrible service. I will never come back to this location ever again.

I am a great fan of Cheesecake Factory, in any city of USA. The only place you can get to taste miscellaneous cuisine from Mexican to American. My all time favorites are bang bang chicken shrimp which is served with rice and gravy and bellagio chicken - chicken crust served with pasta. Yummilicious. But this time I ordered chicken enchiladas, avacado egg roll, bistro shrimp pasta. Bistro shrimp pasta stole the show. I am not fan of red sauce so chiladas was ok. I am surprised about the price of avacado egg roll ?? Seriously $12 ?? You can get 4 avacodos for $1 and 20 egg roll sheets for $2 . It&#39;s just roll filled with avacado. I expected some more tAste complimenting avacado , instead just eating avacodo filling. Definitely, I am not criticizing , when you come up with innovative dish, it has to be innovative rather making us to think serioulsy .... <br><br>This memorial city branch Cheesecake has to attend customer even more spontaneously and make sure the food reaches the table on time. Only this-key element will raise the business up.

Where do i begin? - for starters we were a party of 2, no wait which was nice , as we were set immediately..<br><br>Me and my girlfriend both ordered the same thing .. the 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon and 2 pancakes.. simple enough .. our food came out and mine was OKAY but her pancakes were completely undercooked.. we informed the waitress (after hunting her down because she want very inattentive) and she gave my gf the menu to pick something else out.. my gf ordered a burger (something simple) and asked it to be medium well.. after waiting over 23 minutes for her food i flagged down a manager and he immediately brought her food out which lets me know that her burger was just sitting there ... we get the burger and it is NOT MEDIUM WELL.. it&#39;s burnt !!! Burnt .. my girlfriend is not a complainer but this food is NOT FREE, if you pay for it it needs to be done correctly .. so i flagged down the manager AGAIN and he took it off our bill.. we left with my girlfriend still hungry and pissed off ..<br><br>Our service was mediocre at best but the food was horrible ... i will never ever return again .

Moms review           My mom just loves the chicken ,drinks and cheesecake she said it&#39;s no lie<br><br>Her sons review                      Omg their kid&#39;s spighheti is the best and the sweet tea and the cheesecake mmm

Always good and they are accomodating! I wanted to sit outside and although they had no more staff to service the area they opened it up for us anyway. They have great chicken madiera and chicken piccata. We love it there!

I come here for the ambiance and the nice service. This is definitely one of my fav place to have dinner. Some foods are awesome, some are meehhh.... I usually order the appetizer with many kinds and the salad. also their free breads are fresh and awesome.

Service was great. Restaurant was clean. My lasagna verde was really yummy as was the passion fruit margarita! I stopped by while I was waiting for my hotel room across the street and was happy I did.
Went there for dessert. All of the utensils were dirty and had old food crust on them. They didn&#39;t have the tea flavors they should. Stock up! The service was nice and the dessert was okay

First of all -- we waited 1.5 hr for food. A party of 11. Which is too damn long for some food which half were appetizers. The waiter was very nice but the service was INCREDIBLY slow! The manager finally came by to see what the issue was, BUT, everyone&#39;s food was cold. I ordered fried fish tacos. The breading alone was enough to turn me OFF! Fish was tasteless, and slimy. Rice was OLD and beans were cold. YUCK!!!!!!!!<br>The Cheesecake Factory has never been liked restaurant of mine. Only here for a friend of a friends bday dinner. They just need to serve cheesecakes, apps and wine. That&#39;s it! Never coming here again.
Good food. We ate Saturday for lunch and the portions were big. I love their honey oat bread.

The salad is enormous here.  I wish they didn&#39;t put the dressing completely over my salad,  so I could have had some for the next day,  and applied dressing when needed. <br><br>Amazing service!   Beautiful &amp; Chocolaty Hot coco. Ambiance is Beautiful and romantic. <br><br>Instead the following day my salad was no good.  I just ate the remaining chicken.   The chicken was seasoned to perfection!  I love the chicken on this salad. And the taste of pineapples and mangos. <br><br>My son had the kid bow tie pasta. He ate because he was hungry,  but didn&#39;t care of the sauce.  <br>First time ever having cheesecake.  They have a HUGE SELECTION.  I got the original strawberry.  It was good I guess.  Then again,  I&#39;m not a big fan of cheesecake.  <br><br>This was my second time here,  first time was many years ago.  I didn&#39;t care of their Alfredo pasta.  Pasta is good, texture is great, but the flavor of the sauce in not fond of. Keep in mind,  this is NOT an Italian place. (I will give less starts on the sauce alone.)

***Note this review was only based on happy hour.<br><br>Been to cheesecake factory many times for dinner service and always had a great experience. However, for happy hour this location definitely needs to work on the bar service. Although the bartenders were nice the first bartender took my drink order and never brought the drink. After about 15 minutes the next bartender asked me if I had been helped and I told him that the other guy took my order but never brought the drink he apologized and brought the drink. <br><br>Took forever for the food to come which I didn&#39;t understand why because it was not really busy. When the food arrived, the lady that brought it out spilled the chips on the floor and told me she would be back with a new chips to go with the spinach dip. I waited for about 10 minutes she never came back and my food was cold. I asked the bartender for new spinach dip he sent it back to the manager the manager came over and apologized. <br><br>Although I really do like cheesecake factory for dinner service, this was my first time trying them for happy hour they really need to work on the bar service not sure if I&#39;ll come back.

I ordered 3 desserts yesterday 2 pineapple upside down cheese cakes as well as a warm apple  chrisp. I ordered at 8:22 my pick up time was 8:47! Upon arrival I never received a confirmation check my order was not ready at the time stated. At 8:57 my order came outside Togo. After driving home 5 minutes up the road my WARM Apple chrisp was frozen solid. All the toppings on the side looks like it was just thrown in the bag. Highly disappointed with the service I received even after leaving a 15% tip. This store seems unorganized, over 25 minutes for pre-made desserts that were still not presentable! I still had to go home and wait another 20 minutes to eat it after having to cook it in the oven.  Definitely ruined my night!

I have always come to get cheesecakes but it was my first time eating here. I&#39;m 200% a burguer guy so I had the smoke bbq one but oh boy, meat felt it had been too frozen for too long and it tasted like nothing. Manager was really helpful and he understood the situation, I had only two beers which one I had to personally go to the bar cause it felt hot and my server told me &#34;they&#39;re all gonna be the same&#34;, so yeah, guess I will only come back for the cheesecakes next time.

Very bad service at the restaurant.   Went to the restaurant with my daughter and my dad.    Went to check-in and they told us it will be a 30 minute wait but to check in every 15 minutes and give me a pager and told me the pager does not work outside the parking.     The restaurant is located at the mall and it would be easy to have people go into the mall or the outdoor play area  and give them a call when the table to ready instead of wanting people to stand in the restaurant in tight spaces waiting for a table.    So we went to the play area and came back in 15 minutes as asked and waiting for another 20 minutes for the table.   My daughter is 2 and has problems standing still and waiting.   <br><br>We get our table and the someone came back to get our drink order.   <br>Got our drink I WAS a 1st time customer . Ordered these today along with the buffalo chicken tenders and this is what I received. They were soggy and looked like they have been sitting up for a while. Disappointed and will never patronize again!

been here 2 times now and the first time i came with my girlfriend (im a girl too) and had a homophobic waitress and and had really bad service. now im here right now and been waiting 25 minutes waiting for my bread and they just brought out my lemonade. service is really slow. dont come here

I visited this location on Tuesday 1/8 with my daughter. We had just went shopping at the American girl doll store. After a couple of hours of shopping we had worked up a. Appetite for lunch and I had a gift card to the Cheesecake Factory in my purse which came in handy since I just dropped a lid of money at the doll store. Me and my daughter went inside to the hostess stand with 2 American girl dolls in hand. The hostess greeted us and gave us one of them little buzzer things. I inquired about sitting outside on their covered patio which was rather empty except for one couple dining out there. She said she would check on it for us and said she would see if there were any tables available. I was very confused at that last statement because I could clearly see ALL tables were available except for the one being occupied by one couple. I played along and sat outside on a bench for about ten minutes. Finally she took us outside to a small rickety rocky table for two. I kinda gave her the side eye but said thank you and sat. We were not getting off to a good start but I always try to give people the benefit of the doubt and no one was going to ruin my good mood and this beautiful day with my daughter.<br><br>As we looked over our menus, our server approached us. Very friendly and noticed right away that we had 2 American Girl dolls dining with plus and thoughtfully asked if we would like doll chairs for our dolls. I was very happy, surprised and impressed that they offered AG doll chairs. It&#39;s very smart on their part to be so inclusive since the restaurant is so close to the doll store. Our server, Meketa W. was very attentive and nice. I actually forgot about the hiccups with the hostess. It&#39;s amazing how good service can turn things around. She also noticed how cramped we were at the tiny table for two and offered to move us to a larger table in the center of the patio. It gave us and the dolls a lot more room. That was super thoughtful and I appreciated that. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer.My daughter ordered the chicken tenders from the kids menu and I ordered the egg roll sampler as my entree. We also ordered the celebration cake cheesecake as our dessert to go. The chicken tenders were amazing! I ate one of hers and whatever batter they use is light and crispy but so good. My egg rolls overall were pretty good. A couple of them were a little hard (overcooked) but still edible. Overall, I give this dining visit 4 stars. I would have given it 5 stars if the hostess had been nicer. I also used their restroom and it was clean. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Stopped in here because it was the only place open near my hotel. Who&#39;s running this place? Does anybody care? I realize it&#39;s 10pm on a Sunday, but there is literal poo on the toilet and no toilet paper in the entire men&#39;s room. Went to the bar and there are so many dirty dishes that I couldn&#39;t make a seat out of NINE empty seats. The table behind me has had dishes sitting there for going on twenty minutes now. Great martini though, cheers.

Maybe I&#39;m older and wiser not sure but TCF is not as good and classy like it use to be. I mean I like it but don&#39;t crave it. Everything I&#39;ve eaten is pretty decent. It&#39;s good I wouldn&#39;t say delicious. Good atmosphere. I think what makes me come back is the service. Drinks are good  and desserts can do no wrong. Hope you enjoy.

Ugh I like the food but they couldn&#39;t care less about service. Hostess didn&#39;t want to sit us on the patio even though they had tables open, then took us to an occupied table and then to a dirty one. Was horribly rude asking us to sit even though it was dirty. We refused and had to just stand there and went so far as to hand us the menús to wait till someone cleaned it. It&#39;s the most insulting service I&#39;ve gotten from a host in my life. What good is it to have good food and location if you have horrendous hospitality?

We were seated promptly upon arrival. Our server was very attentive.<br>Their raspberry and strawberry lemonade are fresh and made in the house. They come with free refills as well. <br>The food came out pretty quick. The crab bites were tiny because it consisted of mostly crab meat! The bacon-bacon cheeseburger was very juicy, but a bit bland. They put the onion, pickles, tomato and lettuce on the side. The Bang Bang chicken and shrimp was flavorful and aromatic. It tasted similar to a Thai curry, rather than an Indian one. The Chinese chicken salad tasted tangy and tasty. The fettuccini chicken Alfredo were alright.<br>I would highly recommend the black out cake for dessert!

Went in for a late lunch yesterday with a few friends. We started with fried mac &amp; cheese which was amazing. Our entree&#39;s consisted of carne asada, chicken madeira, chipotle chicken sandwich, and farfalle with chicken &amp; garlic <br>Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted very good. Our server, Santiago, was great. He made sure to check on us frequently and ensure we had everything we needed. I would definitely recommend this location

Again screwed up my door dash order and left out my main reason for placing the damn order!! Of course closed when I tried to order again!! I called them and was told to report it to Door Dash for a credit!! Well thanks a lot, ill have my credit for diner!! Such a disappointment.. again!! Thanks for nothing..

First time being here (Sept 15) in a long time and likely won&#39;t go back any time soon. The service was ok but one of our entrees, turkey sandwich, had MOLD on the bread! Luckily, the individual saw it before they were able to take another bite. YUCK! We also ordered the crusted salmon, a simple side salad, and it wasn&#39;t anything to brag about. Do better on the observations before you send the food out.

This place deserves a 0 rating and I definitely DO NOT recommended for anyone to dine in at this location. <br>On a Saturday evening my family and I wanted to have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory and we came to location in Memorial city due to our convenience. MAGGIANOS OFFERS FREE TAKE HOME PASTA WITH EVERY PASTA PURCHASE. :)

Very poor service , by the waitress and the kitchen.  <br>It took 30 mins to bring out 2 salads and 25 min to bring out my appetizer.  Are waitress is upping are tab by selling us the large salad when we asked for the smaller salads .
DEAD BUGS IN FOOD<br><br>Can&#39;t even get off hold to speak to manager.  20 minutes now <br><br>DISGUSTING

If you&#39;re looking for a place to break your diet this is your place! They&#39;re evil geniuses with the bread and butter they bring to you. Damn you gluten!  Food is always consistent. Waiter was cool. <br><br>For some reason there were flies everywhere. <br><br>Cheese cake was slightly melted when they brought to the table &amp; gave me diarrhea shortly after. I&#39;m just glad it left my body. <br><br>-1 for flies -1 for poorly kept food &amp; last point I took away was for the diarrhea. <br><br>Comfort food at it&#39;s worse. This is Texas!!! The service is extremely slow and I came because I really wanted some cheesecake. I am extremely disappointed as this chain anywhere is usually my go to for cheesecake. The cheesecake was dry and looked and tasted old from the top. I sent it back after a bite. I saw the 2.5 ratings and was skeptical at first but then my appetizer came out(buffalo blast) and they were magically delicious. So I had a false sense of hope. This is the only reason there is 2 stars because the appetizer was good. I probably won&#39;t visit this location again and wouldn&#39;t suggest it. I am always leery of this location because it&#39;s so busy, but today was a treat. <br><br>Service: We were told 20 minutes to wait for a table for 2 but it was more like 7 minutes. The waitress was very friendly and attentive despite the crowded restaurant. I love when an experienced waitress keeps her cool despite a crowd. <br><br>Chicken Riesling: I thoroughly enjoyed the blend of the wine sauce, bacon, mushrooms and chicken.  My only dislike for this dish was the dry spaghetti; however, when I asked the waitress for more sauce, she promptly brought more to the table. <br><br>Meatloaf: My friend enjoyed the meatloaf. She said it&#39;s always her favorite dish. <br><br>We missed dessert this time but we&#39;ll be back. <br><br>I was pleased overall. I personally like more spice but this is a chain, so it was as flavorful as could be.

The wait was only 15-20 minutes on a Sunday afternoon which was short for the Memorial area during that timeframe. When we were seated it did take a while for the server to bring drinks and bread. After the rush cleared out the server was very attentive and personable. Would come again, maybe during the week to try again.

From redemption, cheesecake factory has turned it around. Seems like the last time was not my best experience. I came in a second time after speaking to guest services, decided to give them another chance especially at this location. When I walked in they quoted 40 minute waiting time. I waited for about 30 minutes and got seated. Some of the silverware was dirty, had smudges and dried food on it. It was so dark that no one saw crumbs on the seats until they felt it on their butts. This table was not altogether. I ordered the following:<br><br>Spaghetti and meatballs<br>Herb crusted salmon<br>Chicken piccata pasta<br><br>I decided to get the spaghetti meatballs again just so I can make a true review about the dish. The noodles are al dente, the sauce was nicely flavored, the meatballs were hot, the only downside is that there were no basil leaves like I had before. no one offered parmesan cheese like before either. It seems like this restaurant is a little inconsistent. this dish came out first, I waited several minutes for the next, and several more minutes for the last dish. I would prefer to eat together with my family so I waited and hopes that this dish would not become cold.<br><br>The herb crusted Salmon was cook nicely, a little over cooked For me. Flavors were all there. For example, mashed potatoes were smooth and velvety, the asparagus was cooked correctly. This white sauce on the bottom was just off. I&#39;m not sure what kind of flavor it was, but it tasted like warm milk. It wasn&#39;t my favorite but it did not kill the dish. next time, if I order this, I would probably ask for this sauce on the side. I would definitely recommend someone getting this if they are looking for a lighter dish.<br><br>The chicken piccata pasta was very different. A few thinly sliced chicken breasts lightly breaded and some panko crumbs and topped with mushrooms capers and lemons in this citrus flavored sauce. I think it would taste even better if it was fish for some reason. It was a little overpowering. Full on lemon flavored chicken. With the pasta, it went well together. I don&#39;t think I would order this again for myself but I did enjoy it for the meantime.<br><br>My service was not as great as my last. She seemed a little off because she kept asking what we ordered. Aside from that, she was able to get everything dosing a short period of time. This location isn&#39;t too bad guys

Great food as usual but calling in for orders to memorial Cory location is horrible. I waited 15 minutes on the phone and then they hang up the phone. I called again and all they do is hanging up the phone. This is not a professional way to handle call in orders at all.

This location really needs some help! We came here for my daughters birthday and were highly disappointed. <br><br>The last two times (including this time) the silverware and plates were dirty. Go to any other cheesecake but this one everything here is filthy my cup still had lip stick on it my plate had food residue the waiters all have attitudes and want todo everything but there jobs my food was cold and I&#39;m sure it was on a dirty plate I got better service from the guy cleaning the tables and he looked like he wanted to stab everyone in there I will stick to the Cheesecake Factory at the woodlands

The Cheesecake Factory is where we had our first date, so we always try to return to one on that anniversary.  We no longer reside in the city where we had our first day, but lucky for us, TCF is a chain. <br><br>Last year we dined at the Galleria TCF for our anniversary, but since the weather was so nice this time, we thought we&#39;d dine at a TCF with an outdoor eating area. I arrived around 630 pm. Sat at the bar since im by myself. Worst customer service ever. They are more worried about the service bar than the guest. Im still waiting on my entree after 50 minutes

Terrible!! The taquitos we ordered for an appetizer were cold and bland. First off all the menus were FILTHY!! Full of breadcrumbs and all kinds of other nasty old food!! That really grossed me out. The only thing that was decent was the super sweet artificially flavored lemonade and the celebration cheesecake that&#39;s actually reg. Cake.

The service tonight sucked. We received bread three times before they even took our food order. They brought butter out that had a fly in it. They just offered another butter manager never came by. I wish I could give zero stars. This is the worst service I have ever experienced in a Cheesecake Factory or any other sit down restaurant. I recommend drIving to one of the other Cheesecake factories in the area. We were sat and never greeted, we had to go to the bar for a drink. Worst experience ever. <br><br>I went to this location for a birthday dinner. It was about 9 of us. We waited patiently for an hour to be seated, after saying &#34;15 more minutes&#34; about 5 or 6 times. We later learned that the hostess was waiting for a party of people who wasn&#39;t actually sitting there. They were just taking pictures. EVERYTHING WAS COLD. <br><br>Someone at our table got their dessert before her actual meal. <br><br>The cheesecake I ordered was still frozen. <br><br>When we expressed we were displeased. the manager offered to remake our dishes, and told us our food would only take about 6-10 minutes. Which just made everyone angrier. that makes no sense that we waited an hour and 30 minutes for food that would only take 7 minutes to remake. the servers also looked p&#39;d off at us because we were upset.<br><br>I have been to this location twice. this is the second time I had a horrible experience. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and we received the worst service ever!!! We were barely even acknowledged. For the price of the food here, the service here needs to be improved. The bartenders hated their job. Won&#39;t be returning

Really nice place to eat with friends or family! Nice place for a date. I went there and we were a party of 4. The server Dakota was really nice and she got every order right and perfect with no problems. The reason I gave 4 starts is because of the order took forever to come. We ordered two sandwiches, steak Diane and Caesar salad. Although the plates were hot, but the food were so cold, the cheese was cold and I didn&#39;t really enjoy the sandwich. I would recommend the place but don&#39;t really expect high food taste.

I usually dont eat here and today reminded me just why. First the waiter Steve seemed very unenthusiastic about serving us. Then the table next to us stay dirty the whole time we were there. Nobody wants yo eat next to a dirty table. We asked for margarita no salt, it came with salt. If took about 45 minutes for our food to arrive at 4:00 PM on a Saturday. As for the food,  the potato soup was good, my Turkey sandwich was dry, nothing special at all. The bread was half toasted, so I couldn&#39;t tell if the bread was stale or under toasted. A comete waste of time.

Compared to the galleria location this one is by far more casual. <br><br>I came here for lunch and it was quite enjoyable. I had the skinnylicious burger with a side salad. The burger was really good. I wish it had more flavor, but of course when you get a healthier burger it tends to not compare to their delicious, super fattening ones. <br><br>When I&#39;m not trying to eat light I order the macaroni and cheese burger. It is my favorite thing on the menu, and you won&#39;t be disappointed. <br><br>One thing I wish they would bring back is their portabella on a bun burger. Instead of meat you had a giant mushroom. It was so yummy and flavorful. I&#39;ve tried for years to recreate it at home, but I haven&#39;t perfected it yet.

If I could give this place zero stars I would. It&#39;s the absolutely worst. Food was cold and disgusting. Service is the worst, our server was rude and unwelcoming. Management didn&#39;t seem to care so much either.

This was my second visit at the Cheesecake Factory at Memorial City Mall. It was somewhat of a downer compared to the last time that I visited when it was first opened.<br><br>Ambiance: the place was nicely decorated, but it was little dark at dinner time. Still it was not a big deal. <br><br>Service: It was a midweek night so it wasn&#39;t too crowded. Our party got seated right away. Our waiter came by, introduced himself, took our drinks order and starters, promised to come back with our breads right away then disappeared for 10 minutes. <br><br>We saw him again right around the time our appetizers came out. He came back with our breads, took our entree orders then came back again after we received our main course to ask whether everything was ok.<br> <br>We had our interaction with our waiter again when I ordered desserts for our table and let him know that we were celebrating my friend&#39;s birthday. He somewhat redeemed himself a little when my friend&#39;s Cheesecake came out with a candle and a bit of decoration.<br><br>Food: We ordered fried calamari which was decent and another appetizer that escaped my mind at the moment. I think both items were good.<br><br>My wife ordered shrimp scampi pasta. She felt the pasta was a little dry and was lacking enough sauce. My birthday friend concurred and let our waiter know. He informed his manager and offered to give us take home orders to make up for the subpar dish. We didn&#39;t partake on his offer as we just wanted to let the restaurant know plus we had eaten more than half off the plates already due to hunger.<br><br>My jambalaya pasta was alright but the pasta was a bit hard perhaps due to it being a tad undercooked. Still the dish was edible. I left about half the plate due to its large portion.<br><br>The cheesecakes were as good as they were. We got chocolate cheesecake and the NY style. Both were great<br><br>This visit to the Cheesecake Factory was somewhat disappointing. The service was not up to par. The food in general was below the Cheesecake Factory standard. I used to love the main course here as it was served in a big portion.  I always looked forward to eating the leftover for lunch the next day, but not this time.  Initially I was going to give an average rating of 3-star. After writing this review, I realized that my dining experience here was worse than I thought. The final rating was then adjusted to a 2-star.

I guess we must have went at a good time because we didn&#39;t even have to wait the 20 minutes we were quoted. The waitress was very friendly. I like the ambiance and love love loooove that people mind their on business. The only downside is we got the wrong appetizer, the entree portions are a bit light and a bit bland for my taste but still good. At first I gave 3 stars but had to give another star for the best part of the meal the complimentary bread. Had to change my rating to 5 stars because I guess my taste buds must have been off because finishing my food the next day it tasted so much better. Oh oh the pineapple upside down cheesecake ah man so delightful. They put two of my favorites together now how can u beat that.

I love the food here, unfortunately we got attended 40 minutes after we sat down. Our waiter would disappear and we had to ask someone else for water. Then we finally place our order and wait.... and wait and wait. Our waiter finally comes to our table and says someone else got our plates..... we should&#39;ve just walked out but we were hungry. The waiter then continued to say his manager was comping the meal but then the manager comes and checks on us and says it&#39;s only one entree. We returned one time after that because the service is horrible. We went on a Wednesday.

This restaurant has more than just great cheesecake!<br>Their menu is like a dictionary. I usually order the steak medallions and herb salmon combo. I&#39;ve never complained about the taste of the food as it is usually on point and with good portions. They have a full bar which is rather nice. It does get crowded at times so I usually try to go for lunch. <br>I definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Upon arriving at CCF, there were only valet parking spots available, so had to park further away in the target parking lot.  This parking lot is extremely busy as it is part of the memorial city mall plaza.<br><br>Surprisingly, there was barely a 2-4 minute wait and we were seated. The place was somewhat packed but CCF is fairly big from inside.<br><br>They have a wide selection of menus with different cuisine choices, and this time around, I was feeling Mexican.  <br><br>For appetizer, the guacamole n chips. This was not your traditional guacamole that&#39;s pasty, but more chunky in texture and a whole lotta tomatoes. I&#39;m not used to having chunky bits of avocados in my guacamole. It was more like a guacamole salad.<br><br>For main course, chicken fajita tacos with black beans.  Just average tasting meat and beans. I can&#39;t really brag about it. The price doesn&#39;t justify the quality of food.<br><br>I was not craving cheesecake for dessert.<br><br>Overall, just a so so experience. BTW, had to wait an extra 30 mins in restaurant extra, because it was pouring rain outside, and cars were parked further away.

The service here is awful! This is the 2nd time that I have ordered through DoorDash, and they have gotten the order wrong. I placed my order at 11. The delivery time estimated was 12:30. I had to have my Door dash driver hand the phone to someone who worked at the restaurant to talk to me. I called multiple time with no answer. When I did talk to someone, he said &#34;the order was big and we were confused&#34;.<br>What does that mean? Am I not allowed to place a big order? Sounds like Cheesecake Factory needs to train their team on what &#34;not&#34; to say to the customers. <br>Then I had to call back because they left a salad off the order. When I spoke to someone she blamed the door dash guy. Really? Regardless, you u should apologize for the error. Where is the customer service?<br>Cheesecake Factory- you have a lot of training to do with your staff!

Very disappointed with this location. Been going to Cheesecake Factory for years all over the country and by far this has been the worst experience ever. Our waiter was nasty about making us aware of an up charge on our meal. His attitude toward everything was that he hated his job. As I said before been coming here for years even get the same dish and have never been up charged before. It took about 15 min to get bread and drinks when the restaurant wasn&#39;t even that packed. Kids pasta came out over cooked with barely any sauce on it. <br><br>Only thing redeeming about this location I can say is the chicken mederia was enjoyable and a larger portion than I have had at previous location. Probably won&#39;t be visiting this location again.

I made reservations to celebrate a family event, taking 4 children and my parents ... they wouldn&#39;t allow us to dine together and when we found a restaurant that would they still charged us for the appetizer we couldn&#39;t eat and our drinks.

Yo what&#39;s up it&#39;s ya boy back at it with Cheesecake Factory. This is a place for families that drive Camrys and go to Disney. But really it&#39;s a place to get lost in a big menu and not know what to order. <br><br>Lemme help ya out with that fam. Cheesecake Factory has a massive menu. So you must have a game plan. This is not a fairy tale, I already know how you like it. You should order the buffalo blast. It&#39;s like perfectly crisp fried chicken ready to be dipped in blue cheese. <br><br>For your entree, I recommend the chicken costoletta. It&#39;s thinly breaded chicken breasts that are perfectly coated with a light creamy lemon butter sauce with asparagus and mashed potatoes. They have a lemon zest over it that provides a little more flavor to the dish.  The serving amount is massive and I&#39;m sure you&#39;ll have enough to pack for lunch the next day. Don&#39;t forget to take your girl to the mall and get her a new outfit and bounce that thing like woah.
No wait at all :) on a Sunday after church, so glad cause I was starting to get HANGRYYYY. <br><br>Didn&#39;t get a picture of my cheesecake but the tiramisu cheesecake was delicious

I&#39;ve been to this location many times but this was the first time I&#39;ve had such a great waiter and great service! <br><br>I came with 2 friends just for cheesecake and so we decided to sit at the high tables near by the bar area and our waiter Ryan H. came by after 10 minutes to get our orders for drinks first. My friend and I ordered hot tea and other friend ordered a sprite. The sprite was brought to us and 2 cups of hot tea but our choice of teas came later and Ryan owned up to taking a long time because of so much going on (there were 3 birthdays and they pulled him to sing happy birthday with the group while he was getting our teas). He didn&#39;t charge us for the tea which was so nice! <br><br>He brought us a fresh basket of bread and butter and our cheesecakes later which were delicious as always! I didn&#39;t finish my cheesecake so I had him box my cheesecake for me and he even gave me whip cream! (not usually included probably because it melts so easily) but I really loved the service and how nice he was! I&#39;d recommend Ryan H. as a waiter for any group party or if you&#39;re ever just wanting a great waiter!

Located by Memorial Mall. Parking on some night can be hard to find especially during the holidays. They do offer valet parking but you can just find yourself parking. Good thing we were seated right away as it wasn&#39;t too crowded and we only had 4 people. <br><br>We were waiting for the bread to come out since it was complimentary. After a while, we had to ask the waiter for it. It&#39;s unlimited refill and it was quite a long wait for the food so we indulged in two trays of bread. The brown bread was pretty good with a sweet taste and the white bread was just your usual bread. <br><br>Strawberry daiquiri: About $9. Mixed with rum. It was tasty and a good size with a fresh strawberry on top. <br><br>Chicken Chipotle pasta: About $16. The plate was huge and it took two people to finish it. Make sure you mix it together. The sauce was just right. <br><br>White chocolate raspberry cheesecake: 7inch. If you want a whole cake then they said it&#39;s takes about an hour and a half to thaw out because it&#39;s frozen but we still try to eat it anyway.

This Cheesecake Factory location needs some serious overhaul with customer service.... Maybe the Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t pay their employees enough to actually do their job... who knows... but....someone at the corporate office OR the branch VP needs to experience how disappointing it is to eat at this establishment. Advice from a paying customer who will never spend a penny at your restaurant: Send testers to The Memorial location and hire better management.

Love coming here since they have so many options to choose from. The menu literally had something for everyone and they have lunch specials even on the weekends which is nice. I haven&#39;t gotten the chance to try the cheesecake since the food portions are so big and I end up too full for dessert. But definitely need to come and try dessert since it is the Cheesecake Factory.haha.
There&#39;s so many good things on the menu I especially like the shrimp scampi I ordered the shrimp and angel hair by mistake but it&#39;s still very tasty with a tomato-based sauce and basil

Cheese cake factory is a great place for comfort foods and more. My wife and I came here to have the delicious appetizer the avocado wraps. Which were amazing and prepared just right. For my main course I had the vegetable burger which was ok. The quinoa patty was too mushy for my taste. Other than that the place was nice, prompt customer service and a clean area. I also I should note that there is a wait to be seated depending on what time you come. Our wait was about 15 minutes. Also the place is pretty noisy so if you like quiet and intimate this not your spot. But I will definitely come again for them delicious avocado wraps!!!!

Was here yesterday with a group for birthday. It was eaining hard outside but the place was oretty crowded. The girl aking care of us was very mice and attentive. She did take good care of us, sing happy birthday to the boy and even got him a sunday. Our food was ok, not great like I&#39;ve heard. Spicy crispy chiken was overcooked and burn. Alfredo chicken fettuccine was bland. The only thing good was the jamaican pepper shrimp.

Good food for most part but service has been horrible. Today got ignored by two bartenders that on purpose walked by and waited on others that came in after. Asked for manager that made drinks and took order. Other bartenders never once even offered an apology for bad service.
The manager Julie is way too kind. She helped me with my order with door dash with such professionalism and kindness. A great experience like that is definitely the driving factor for me to return.

This is your standard Cheesecake Factory location.  I don&#39;t know about you, but with Cheesecake Factory.. I don&#39;t think I could ever really hate it.  Tons of options, decent pricing considering the portion sizes, and there seems to be a location everywhere.  This location is located in a mall.. not sure the mall name as I&#39;m not local to Houston.  Seemed like a smaller mall though.  Also a hospital was attached, and a Target around the corner.  Parking was pretty nuts.  And we went during lunch time.  Our server, Melissa was pretty nice, attentive.. until of course she sat on our table during a convo with us.. SERIOUSLY? Yes, she really did do that. Weirddd.<br><br>Also, on a side note.. it&#39;s located pretty close to the American Girl store, so they give you little doll seats that clip onto the table so your doll can join you for the meal.  Pretty cute, was the highlight of my daughters lunch.  <br><br>Other than that, there&#39;s not much else to point out.. food is what you&#39;d expect at any other location.

So the cheesecake factory has always been consistent on service and food. Odd I have never yelped it, but now is the time. Tool my gf for a late valentine&#39;s flat date.<br><br>The bad this time:<br>The service today was extremely poor in the beginning, 32 minutes to get our entrees ordered. Which was 18 minutes after we got our apps. Delievered by someone elae. Our server disappeared after taking our app and drink ordered. Funny how I know? I took pictures of the outdoor seating, drinks, everything, check it out. Never got the servers name, never told us, never cared after Scott stepped in <br><br>The good:<br>First off, Scott the manager got on top of our server. After speaking up to the host after not seeing our server for 20 minutes. Great management,<br>Now the food, <br>Fried zucchini, so tasty, and a great appetizer to have.<br>Long Island ice tea, fantastic, mixed well and not too strong.<br>Jambalaya, tasty, delicious with a small kick of spice, chicken and shrimp in jambalaya was cooked well.<br>Finally a mousse cheesecake, which was nice to share. I&#39;m not the b8ggest fan of their cheesecake, but my gf raves about it.<br><br>Overall, could&#39;ve been a giant mess visiting, but the atmosphere, food, and management helped save this review from a poor review.

Paid a visit here for a friends birthday &amp; let&#39;s just say I wasn&#39;t to satisfied with the food or the service. I&#39;m not one to write a bad review for unsatisfactory experiences, only for those that are bad, so I&#39;ll just leave this review at that &amp; wait for my next visit.

My wife and I dropped by for a late dessert on a weekday night. This Cheesecake Factory had the typical dark ambiance as most other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s I&#39;ve been to. It&#39;s almost too dark in there! We got seated promptly at a small booth and the server was very kind. He brought us some fresh bread even though we were just there to get dessert. That&#39;s about where the highlights of our short visit stopped.<br><br>As soon as I opened my menu a piece of cucumber or some sort of wet vegetable fell on my hand. I brushed it off considering it was just after dinner time and since it&#39;s so dark in there, they probably didn&#39;t see it on the menu. We ordered a &#34;fresh&#34; strawberry cheesecake to share with a decaf latte. The cheesecake was all but fresh. It tasted like a standard frozen cheesecake and the strawberries were not fresh at all. They had that slightly artificially preserved texture and coating. Definitely not worth $9 for this medium sized cheesecake. I was hoping that at least the slice would be relatively large like I had remembered The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s cheesecake being but it was pretty small. <br><br>Most likely will not come back...

We visited on a weekday evening and were seated in the bar area. The service was SLOW and at times nonexistent. I had to ask where is my beer? May we have bread? The waitress was never around. I ordered the avocado toast on artisan bread. What I got was smashed avocado that tasted like lime. It was thinly, thinly, and again thinly, smeared on my bread. I didn&#39;t order this! Avocado toast is not flavorless, limey guacamole! I put it on the table next to me as I waited for the waitress. She didn&#39;t show back up for a good 15 minutes so I had to share my partners awful, sad salad. Fast food and slow service sums this place up.

I&#39;ve dined at Cheesecake Factory numerous times. There are no reservations available, for it is walk in only. <br><br>Huge restaurant with multiple chains around. There is a full bar present located within, different at each location. Despite the number of people, it doesn&#39;t feel like you&#39;re sitting in a room with strangers. You have your privacy due to the spacing.<br><br>Servers first come to ask for your drinks and bring a batch of complimentary white and brown bread. I always ask for brown only because I prefer it than the white, trust me. The brown bread slightly has a sweet taste to it. You can ask for refills. <br><br>FOOD:<br>Menu is broad and fantastic. There is something for everyone. On a diet? Try the skinnylicious menu. Small plates? Appetizer? Pasta? Burgers? Steak? Vegetarian? Literally great menu and variety. <br><br>Skinnylicious Salmon Rolls (4/5): Is this really part of the Skinnylicious menu? The 4 rolls were oily but tasted delicious. <br><br>Fried Macaroni and Cheese (4/5): My family goes nuts about this. I&#39;m not a big fan as they are, but we order this every time. There are 4 pieces filled with a bunch of macaroni in cheese balls. Marinara sauce is included. Think of mac + cheese sticks if you need an idea of what it would taste like.<br><br>Southwest Chicken Sandwich (3/5): I wasn&#39;t a big fan of this. Flavors were there but I wouldn&#39;t order this again. This reminded me of the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta due to the flavor. Bread was just a little too hard for me.<br><br>Bang-Bang Chicken and Shrimp (4/5): This was the first plate I ever tried at a Cheesecake Factory. Definitely a recommendation if you&#39;re not sure what to eat. I even tried to make a replica of it at home, Google does wonders. This is a Thai-based entree which is not spicy at all. Great flavor though especially with the peanut sauce!<br><br>Chicken Piccata (4/5): I love pasta with lemon, and I always seem to order this lunch portioned dish. The reason why I knock off a star is the oil. Too much oil. Pasta may seem bland, but I think the amount of flavor is ideal. Everything balances out when you eat it all together. Also, it is light on the stomach for the most part. <br><br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta (5/5): Literally, best thing ever. My family always orders this when I&#39;m here. If you have not tried it, order it. I would recommend the dinner portion for your lunch the next day. It isn&#39;t spicy what so ever, and the flavor is damn good. This is a penne pasta with chicken breast strips with cream based sauce. <br><br>A star is deducted due to the service. Service is always unpredictable here depending on when you come and if the server is new. My biggest thing is when my water is already rock bottom, and I have to remind the waiter two times before it is refilled. Fill my drinks and you&#39;ll make me (and everyone) happy. <br><br>Overall, great restaurant to dine at whether it be business, family, or friends. Although it may get a little loud, amount of food and price together are reasonable.

My experience was kind of meh. We sat outside and got seated quickly. The best part of the meal was the bread at the beginning. I ordered the steak diane med well. The food seemed like it took a really really long time to come out. And when it did come out, it was like warm. My boyfriends sister ordered the medallions, med well and her steak came out extra well done. It looked like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for forever. We sent it back and the manager came out to apologize and offered her a free salad. Her remake even took a really long time to come out, but this time half of it was med well and the other half was rare. I mean the whole inside was pink and bloody. The server that we had was super nice and his service was really good. There were even two or three other tables that were sitting outside that had issues too. I guess maybe if you go, wait for a table inside, maybe you&#39;ll get better luck

Everybody loves the Cheesecake Factory right!!? This one is always crowded, so be prepared to wait. The good was very sub-par, had great flavor, but came out pretty cold. Our waitress had a lot of tables that she was tending to, so we were forgotten about! Their menu is very very vast- so you&#39;ll find whatever it is that you have a taste for!

I have never been to a Cheesecake Factory, and now probably never will.  Spent an hour waiting for a 30 minute table and when we finally got it, it was dirty, and not set.  When they set it one of the plates was dirty.  We talked to a manager and left.  On the way out we found out that there was open seating at the bar.  Very frustrated.  Please do not bother coming here.

I have been to this location numerous times since I&#39;m in the area a lot.  I usually only come for drinks, apps and dessert though since I hate dining at chains.  I like the egg roll sampler app, just about any of the cheesecakes, and their cocktails are decent but never strong enough.  Their happy hour ends by 6pm, so I usually can never make it on time for that.<br><br>Service is hit or miss for the most part.  I try to sit in the bar for better service since Im closer to the items I want the most and they have servers in that area as well, but that never seems to help.

First time back to cheese cake factory in a couple of years. The food was good, nothing crazy different or interesting but still good. The service was great, the young lady that helped is knew the menu very well and was very helpful and friendly. <br><br>I did enjoy that the children&#39;s menu had a lot more to offer than other places. They had Salmon, pasta, better options than just chicken nuggets. <br><br>will return with our son, he enjoyed a lot.

CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE ; My Date &amp; I Arrived At 8:00 PM Sharp On A Sunday The Restaurant Wasn&#39;t Busy At All. So As I Approached The Hostess Podium Another Family Arrived The Hostess Advised Us It&#39;ll Be A Wait So The Family Behind Us Gets To The Podium With The EXACT Same Amount Of People As My Party &amp; They Were Seated Immediately , So I Thought Maybe They Had A Reservation But As More People Began To Walk In &amp; Are Getting Seated Immediately I Walked Back Up To The Podium And Stated That Was Still Waiting To Be Seated. So The Hotess Immediately Escorted Myself &amp; Party To A Table At 8:55 PM. After Being Seated The WAITER ARRIVES His Name Was Chris He Looked As If He Didn&#39;t Wanna Be At Work. After Bringing The Drinks We Immediately Ordered Out Food I Order The Fried Chicken Crispy Sandwich At 9:21 PM He Brings The Food Out. My Meal Came With Fries That Were Cold &amp; Soggy. And The Chicken Sandwich Kept Sliding Out It&#39;s Breading! After Eating It Was 9:50 PM. I Asked For The Check Which Took 20 Minutes To Bring Out. THERE WAS NO ONE IN THE RESTAURANT I&#39;ll NEVER VISIT THIS LOCATION AGAIN !!!!

We went for dinner and were seated immediately but we did not receive a greeting or anything until 15mins later. We noticed the silverware were really dirty even with food on them still. The table was super sticky and still had crumbs of the bread we didn&#39;t receive. Instead of dinner we just decided to get dessert due to being uncomfortable with the way we saw the silverware and the plates. Will not be returning to this location.

The service was really slow and it took a long time to get seated and it wasn&#39;t full. The food was horrible.... i ordered the chicken alfredo and the noodles were UNDERCOOKED , chicken was BLAND. I would save my money bc the food comes in tiny portions and is overpriced and not worth it

I went here for my birthday and I am glad I chose to come here. We got lucky to have Max as our waiter! He was very helpful and prompt. The food was delicious and it didn&#39;t take too long to get served.

Came here having high expectations to celebrate my boyfriend&#39;s birthday but the server did not even pay attention that much because we were not hungry and only bought 1 entree/ drink. I told the server, next thing, he came with 1 scope of ice cream with candle and did not sing. He said everyone is too &#34;busy&#34;. Cheesecake factory, yall need to work on teamwork. Don&#39;t ruin the celebration/surprise. Thank you
Don&#39;t waste your money here. Overpriced for terrible food and service is absolutely absurd. Do yourself a favor and eat at a real restaurant.

Unfortunately we had terrible experience. The waitress was super friendly and was always ready for more bread when we asked for it and when we ran out. However, our order got messed up and I never received my food. Everyone finished their dinner and I&#39;m still waiting on mine. This is terrible especially since i have diabetes and I&#39;ve already accommodated the insulin. We ordered 3 of the factory combos and only received 2. My sister ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza and it tasted terrible. She described it as chewed up chicken nuggets. In my opinion the chicken was super dry and the breading kept falling off. But that was what I had since they decided to forget my plate. When we decided to take the food home, they &#34;ran out&#34; of large boxes and gave us 2 cheesecake size boxes and told us to just cut the food in half!!! My food finally arrived 30 min after everyone started eating. 2 people finished eating and it was basically me and the kid with the awful chicken Parmesan. I&#39;m giving it 2 stars because our server was incredibly amazing. She sang happy birthday to my dad and really went out of her way to make our day special.
As always you can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. We went to Happy Hour and had the Nachos and Cheesecake. Everything as FANtastic!!

I did dread to come here because my first experience wasn&#39;t too great. It took FOREVER to get us seated and I did expect worst because the cheesecakes were half off but to my surprise we got in pretty quickly (10-15 minutes on a Sunday). When I got my slice of cheesecake, it looked sad (melted and small) but it was pretty filling. One slice can be split between two people I&#39;d say, especially if you&#39;re already getting an entree; the food is pretty heavy. <br><br>I usually like to go in the mornings for cake and coffee (=^ェ^=)

This place is not what it used to be.  Went there for brunch/lunch on a Sunday and found the portion sizes to be a complete disappointment.  The stuffed mushroom appetizer was tiny.   My wife ordered the shrimp scampi which came with 5 shrimp and a tiny portion of pasta.  Shrimp skimpy would be a better description.  We used to just assume we would leave here with a couple of takeout boxes because the portions were so generous.  I guess those days are over.  The quality of food was decent but the service was odd.  There were three of us in our party but each entree was brought to the table separately with a few minutes between each one. This  place definitely does not have the wow factor I remember from years past.

This was the first time I believe that I have eaten at The Cheesecake Factory! It was a Saturday night. Long waits everywhere. But they told us 40 minutes but was only like 20 min. It was date night for my fiancé and I and we both had the New Orleans Pasta w crusted chicken. Let me tell you that this was the best pasta dish I have ever had anywhere! Bar none! Then we had a piece of coffee, caramel, cheesecake! To die for! We could only eat half of our entrees so leftovers the night after at the hotel. We had two of Thier Long Island Iced Teas also that were killer! Wait staff was excellent. Great atmosphere for a great dining experience!

Love this spot, service a little slow. Got seated quick for a Friday. Sat on the Patio and watched the Friday night movie from the mall, although kids were noisy it was a relaxing atmosphere. The fried macaroni, and egg roll platter hit the spot, topped with a Mai Tai (extra strong). Just what I needed to end a looong tensed week.

We were hoping to enjoy Tuna tartar. Not available at the moment, we were disappointed about it.  My wife was cold and wanted a hot tea, but it never came to the table, by the time the server remembered, my wife was fine already ( at least 10 min).<br><br>We ordered two pasta dishes and they were good. Chicken was quite tasteless on one of the pastas when it was supposed to be a ginger honey glazed chicken. <br><br>Getting waters refilled it&#39;s more like a dream, something so basic on a restaurant. <br><br>We witnessed a fork being dropped by a neighbor table. The poor boy was ignored by : waiter, busser, hostess, etc. Finally waittress kicked it BY mistake and she had to pick it up!!!

Lunchtime, happy hour or for dinner, this place is a winner.  I visited for lunch at about 12:15 and was delightful surprised that we were immediately seated. The restaurant was quite busy but the atmosphere was rather relaxed. <br><br>Our waiter-in-training was very cordial and provided good service. He kept our drinks refilled without us asking which is always a plus for me. <br><br>The bathroom was immaculate!  Although I didn&#39;t see an attendant, it was clear that management has assigned someone to maintain them. <br><br>The menu is big and portions are hearty!  My eyes popped when my food arrived. I opted for chicken sliders with a side of sweet potato fries. It was $9.95 plus $1.00 for the fries which in itself is a good deal.
