But those same sliders are only $5 at the bar during happy hour. <br><br>My meal was topped off with a slice of Dulce de ale he cheesecake. Can you say divine?

Great service, really good cheesecake. The mamosas were really good a little strong for my taste. I did not have food because I came for desert but my friends food looked and smelled really good so I can&#39;t wait to try it next time

The food was good.  It was pleasing to look at and eat.  Everything was properly cooked and was well flavored.  <br><br>Unfortunately the ticket time and table service fell short. <br><br>First, I was out with my wife, her mother, and a friend of hers from work.  We were celebrating a birthday. <br><br>The timeframes between visits were entirely to long.  Either overloaded or incompetent wait staff leaves us feeling unimportant.<br><br>When the meals came out, they served me first, the only man at the table.  When did ladies first die?<br><br>Drink refills were at a glacial pace. <br><br>When it came to desert, I was the only one that ate.  The three ladies took cheesecake to go.  Before I ordered, I asked if it could come quickly as to not hold up my party.  The to go orders came out 15 minutes later and my desert another 15 minutes later.  It was frustrating.  They have work to do.

Excellent service and delicious flavorful food ! Our server - Azenneth L was super nice and took care of us by far the best waitress I had ever met in our lives. She&#39;s amazing ! Why can&#39;t we have a server like her for every restaurant we go to . Everything we ordered we delicious- gumbo , pasta , salmon /shrimp and mash potatoes combo . Such a lovely nice interior design restaurant. The wait was just 20 mins wait on a Sunday holiday weekend. Not bad !

I like the food at the Cheesecake Factory but don&#39;t ever order take out here. I ordered a burger A Slice of Cheesecake and it took 35 minutes to get that. I should just ask for a table ordered at the table and then ask for to go box it would have been faster. Hell i could have gone home and ordered from doordash. It would have only taken only 20 minutes longer and I would have been home in my jammies. The kitchen needs to be more respectful of people waiting in their Lobby for to-go orders. 35 minutes for a burger is crazy.

Delay in sitting in an empty restaurant. Sat down to give order at 11:30am received food at 12:45pm. Service was extremely slow. Gave waitress our food order at the same time as our drink order, took 45 minutes to get bread for our table. Not very friendly...made reference to lots of people and orders going in at same time. Our cold sandwiches were out after everyone got meals. When I received my sandwich it was difficult to eat because bread was broken on top.

The service was awful this time I went to this restaurant. It took 45 minutes for basic thing as Bread.The waiter was not good at all. We called for the manager to bring bread out to us. I always get orange chicken at least that didn&#39;t change it was wonderful. I am sorry have to write this kind of review but the service was really bad.

Very poor service. Waiter seemed like he was lost most of the night. Never got drinks, appetizers came out two minutes before our food did. Then to top it all off it literally took over an hour to get our bill sorted out for a party of eight. After all of the trouble  the best response and explanation the manager could give us was sorry. We were in the hell for three hours due to delays and billing issues and an insincere sorry is all we got.  Terrible experience. It was clear that from the waiter to the Manager customer experience  is not a Priority for this company. I will never go to Cheesecake Factory again.

I was hesitant about coming to this location after reading some of the reviews and immediately regretted it once we got seated. The table and bench were dirty, as well as the plates, and all the silverware still had food on them! Once our food arrived, our waiter brought us an extra plate, which was nice, but it had food stains on it too!! I don&#39;t know what was going on, but I had to clean all the dishes and silverware before we started eating. Makes you wonder how it is in the kitchen...

This location has been one of the worst Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve ever been to. Not only is this smaller and more crowded, the service is disappointing and food is mediocre. <br><br>Is being seated almost immediately and then not meeting your server until ten minutes later fine with you? Is finally meeting your server and placing your orders for drinks and entrees, then receiving your tea and coffee another 15 minutes later also okay with you? Well if you answered yes to those questions then this would be your perfect lunch/dinner/date/happy hour option.<br><br>My party of 5 had begun to wonder if our server had forgotten about us or if she was extremely busy or just inefficient. Whatever the case was, it was clearly unacceptable. Our coffees were brought out in a clear mug, no dish. It was lukewarm at best and had a soapy dishwater after taste, bleh. We had a difficult time flagging down our server to ask for a replacement. After waiting an hour, and 2 coffee refills later, our entrees were still nowhere to be found. We had to speak with management about the service and he was apologetic. Our entrees then came shortly after and while we all finished our meals (starving mode by then), it was not good enough to say that we&#39;d come back. <br><br>Overall a bad experience and I do not recommend dining at this location, unless you answered yes to the two questions I posed above.

So very Disappointed  <br>I love this place because there is a dish for every pallet the menue is extensive so if you are with a group of people there is always something for everyone. I usually come to the Memorial city location at east 3 times a week and everyone is usually great. <br>Today we had such an awful experience a Freind in my group ordered a steak and requested it med well and chatted she got a very rare steak .. poorly seasoned and could not eat it. She did not want to send it back but the waiter insisted so he had the manager come over and he apologized and placed a new order<br>THE CHEF OR SO CALLED CHEF CAME OUT TO OUR TABLD AND LECTURED MY FREIND ABOUT WHAT SHE ORDERED<br>HE WAS Loud obnoxious and caused a big scene. My friend was mortified. She ordered a steak Pittsburgh style and the reason I&#39;m updating this review is because I wanna or the same friend to Longhorn and they got it spot on that chef at this cheesecake company did not even know what he is<br>Talking about and even if he was right he had no right to come out to the table humiliate my friend like that.<br>I don&#39;t know where  got them from bbut they need to send him back To the culinary school so he can learn how to cook<br>Even the waiter felt so bad for my friend I will never forget this incident and definitely never dine  there again<br>The prophetic response from this PR person over there It does not even apologize for what happened. Are you kidding me. Maybe you should have your employees drug tested because this is not normal behavior of anyone working in the food industry. Absolutely disgusting I wish I could give them a  -10*star horrible place<br>And horrible management
Chicken Madeira w/ Tropical tiki Punch super good bartender Tyler was so helpful and nice

Its been quite a long time since my last visit, in all sincerity still makes me feel it&#39;s overpriced! <br>Service is their biggest flaw.  Table was dirty and they never took the time to clean after we were done with our meal.. it&#39;s just lack of service management need to go around the place to make sure tables look right not like a low profile taqueria.  Server was more interested in getting the tab closed than keeping up with a clean presentable table.  Houston do have better places for sure, specially at this price point.

This location is my favorite location for the Cheesecake Factory in the Houston area due to the service. If I&#39;m craving my Chicken Parm Pizza, I come on in. When coming in, I request Michelle. She does such a phenomenal job with balancing all her tables. She always makes sure that my glass is full and never empty. As always, when in the Houston area I will be returning to this location for my chicken parm pizza, and the service!

I love their food and desserts but the prices hurt the pocket. But you do have to agree, sometimes the price is worth what you receive to eat. This place is a splurge type of place. Where either it&#39;s a business meet or friends meeting up, after a long period or short. Either way it&#39;s a splurge type of restaurant.

So I tried to place a take out order<br>And was placed on hold for almost 10 minutes and I thought they forgot me so I called back and was again put<br>On hold for 8 or so minutes and was<br>About to hang up as in total I had<br>Almost Waited 20 Minutes to place a to go order when somebody picked<br>Up.  I spoke with Slyvanna who is apparently one of the manager<br>Because I asked to speak with one and after<br>I told her I had been on hold 20 minutes<br>She just said she was Sorry.  Should have said sorry from the get go.  She told me the food would be ready in 20 minutes which ironically is the same<br>Time it took me to be on hold...this is the first time I have had ever had poor service at a Cheesecake Factory.  Sadly experience has taken away from the food.

Came to cheese cake  for steaks and there were out 3 different types of stakes. Worst is that the manager did not try to accomodate us for their mistakes i still ended up paying full price for the meal i did not want. Worst cheese cake factory in houston.

One of my favorite place to go for quick and reasonably priced restaurants.  I love their Hibachi steak.  You can&#39;t go wrong starting off with the Tex Mex egg rolls.  Nice atmosphere.  Memorial City mall next door.  A walking distance away.  Great convenient location.  This place is a keeper.

Compared to the Sugarland, Texas location this place has an outdoor seating area that will make you feel like you are the four seasons hotel. Very classy. There is also a walk up area connected to the building next door. Our server was very attentive. But I forgot his name. -2stars for that gnat that kept landing on my food weak cocktails. We were ordering from the happy hour menu. Mostly $5.95 range. The most hefty servings compared to other places happy hour dim sum small plates. The small plates here are actually decent size  portions. The cauliflower OMG! So good! Crunchy sweet and while you chewing tell your self you are eating General T&#39;so chicken from the China man. The corn tamale cakes with avacado so yummy, creamy,  and filling! Trust me with these two dishes you will not miss the meat.
Loved the Baja Shrimp Taco! The service was great and quick. Would go back for sure to try out a verity if their dishes.

Normally a great place to take Mom for mother&#39;s day. This past Saturday was a horrible experience..... One that may test the possibility of us ever coming back. Let&#39;s hope they fix their service issues. I&#39;ll be looking for good reviews to THINK about going back.

I really enjoy all of the food items I have tried at The Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;ve been to this location on multiple occasions. The staff has always been friendly and fairly attentive. <br><br>My favorite dish has to be the Spicy Cashew Chicken and every time I have ordered the dish it has been consistent in portion and taste, which is fantastic! <br><br>The cheesecakes I&#39;ve had at this location have also always been delicious! <br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a nice little dinner, come visit this location.

Where do I begin first.. This won&#39;t be a long winded review bc there isn&#39;t much to say except don&#39;t order the meatloaf and go to the sister location Grand Lux better choices for lunch dinner or brunch and the staff are exceptionally great* <br><br>There&#39;s one dish which is the firecracker salmon that consist of a portion size of 4 rolls for $12 so on that note I&#39;ll pass..<br><br>Service is mediocre and the prices are inflated for decent size portions of food but horrible flavor and consistency that hasn&#39;t changed over the course if years*<br><br>If I had to say something good about this place it would be the lemonade.. I&#39;m not a fan of Lemonade but it comes as a choice with My cub kids meal and it was dee-lish*
The wait time was horrendous..the food was not what we expect from cheesecake factory...will not visit again!!!

My go to item is their cashew chicken salad.  I don&#39;t know if they modify or change their recipe but today it look and taste totally different.  The lettuce was shredded into such small pieces that it losts it crunch.  <br>Service was good and appetizer bread they give is always  good (especially the chocolate? color one).  It was 30 min wait for our table and another 35 minutes for our food (we arived at 7pm).  Usually food come out fast but not with this visit.  Its a hit or miss.  Parking sucks.  Be prepare to park far or drive around few minutes.  They do have valet.

The Cheesecake Factory is nice and has a great atmosphere.  I particularly chose this location because of parking and location.  You can either valet or park throughout the mall&#39;s parking lot for free.  I recommend going after the mall closes or before it opens on the weekends for better parking.  My friends and I recently went on a Friday night afterhours and I was able to park up front.  Nice view of The Square, an open area similar to CityCentre.   Beautiful patio I want to try for brunch.  Great for groups, I had no wait at 9pm to be seated.  Of course I&#39;ll be back, I love the vibe.  Plus, they were open until midnight on Friday!  Girls night out coming again soon Lol!

My wife and I celebrated our 13th Anniversary at Cheesecake Factory.  We simply couldn&#39;t have had a  more enjoyable evening. <br><br>We were seated promptly and our server, Peter greeted us warmly. He took our drink order and reviewed some recommendations for dinner.  We split the vegetable salad with a pomegranate vinaigrette.   The salad was so large, we thought they had brought us two salads. <br><br>Our meals were perfectly timed and served after we finished our salads. <br><br>For dinner, my wife ordered a CF Combo of Steak Dianne and Shrimp Scampi   I ordered Hibachi Steak with wasabi mashed potatoes &amp; asparagus tempura.   The meals were simply perfect.  Steaks cooked to perfection-nice sized garlic shrimp.  Not too heavy and subtle garlic.  <br><br>Here&#39;s where the service became exceptional.  The server delivered the wrong combo to our table.   When we pointed it out, apologies flowed and they immediately started to prepare a new meal for my wife. Then, they offered to take my plate to keep it warm and serve with my wife&#39;s dinner.  They ended up remaking both of our dinners and again served them piping hot and perfectly prepared.  <br><br>While we waited (briefly) for our remade dinner, the server Peter, his assistant Yousef and the manager all came by to apologize again.  <br><br>Dessert was complimentary.  We chose the turtle caramel cheesecake. Decadent. <br><br>The evening was perfect.  We simply couldn&#39;t have asked for more.  Kudos to The Memorial Cheesecake Factory.  5 Stars.

Unfortunately management is a management and it affects the direction of any restaurant rather it&#39;s a national chain or mom and pop. When you go to Cheesecake Factory you are not expecting stellar service the same you received from a 4 or 5 star but you do expect to be greeted if it is empty or at least  acknowledged within the first 10 minutes of sitting down.  Everyone is human but somethings are just unacceptable in service.

First of all the woman at the desk was rude. She asked us how many people were in our party we told her and then she told us to &#34;Step Aside.&#34; I was shocked. Our waitress Joly was amazing very informative and friendly. My husband and I shared a bang bang shrimp and chicken dinner. It was very bland. The meat had no seasoning and it was a Thai dish. I spoke with a manager Jed regarding the rude hostess and he did rectify the situation Thanks Jed and Joly for helping fix a situation that could have been a worse experience.

Worst service of any Cheesecake Factory. 45 minutes after ordering the manager apologized for the delayed food. Then 10 minutes later they bring my fiancé plate but not mine. 5 minutes later mine comes out. Nothing offered, not even a cheesecake. I don&#39;t typically write bad reviews as I don&#39;t expect much from chain restaurants but the management staff at this location is not very keen on what good service is. The server was very polite but put in a bad situation. Unfortunate for her for our dining experience. I do not recommend this location at all!!! Go to the Galleria if you desire this restaurant chain. They are typically busy but have always had good service at that location. Thumbs down on management!

I always get the egg roll sampler it&#39;s really amazing! They have amazing drinks, they also have homemade lemonade you can add vodka to! Hello so amazing. The manager Kim is super attentive she saw us waiting and diligently took care everything so gracefully. Our server was great as well!

This place has really gone to sh*t...ordered the Mexican chicken salad and no chicken on top...had to dig through the salad just to find 3 slivers of chicken. I really think it was a joke. Flagged down the waitress who told me the salad was to have 2 chicken breasts. I looked at her and said &#34;does this look like even one?&#34;. She took it back and the manager came by to correct. We ordered the stuffed mushrooms for the appetizer but the server brought it after the entrees came..which wasn&#39;t a big deal but why the F*ck would a restaurant serve the stuffed mushrooms with only the top served...it was little literally small mushroom CAPS in some weird oil with a sprinkle of cheese on top..it was HORRIFIC. I should have took a picture of it. Overall the quality of the food here has been cut cheaply.

Food was good, but our server was horrible! (Still tipped tho). Server: Britney A (according to receipt), on 9/13/19, around 5-6pm. It took my friend and I, 30 min of waiting and asking her for utensils before she brought us any. She messed up my friend&#39;s drink. She was so inattentive that her coworker had to come to our table. She was rude and had an attitude, which we tried to excuse for the possibility that she may lack experience. My friend requested a plate and we watched as she went over to chat with her coworkers for a few minutes instead of bring us a plate. 2 tables with other servers, who came in after us, were able to complete their meal before us. Unprofessional waitress!

Would give this piece of shit place a zero if I could. Walked in around 830pm; greeted by an extremely rude and grumpy young lady who walked us to our table but sped off so fast that for a second we couldn&#39;t find her. When we walked in she was slouched over the counter on her phone and looked completely unpresentable, almost dirty looking. We sat down, waited a good 15 min before our not so friendly waitress, I believe Michelle was her name, she has curly blondish brunette hair and a little chubby, did not know how to greet just straight asked what we wanted to drink, drinks came I then asked for bread and of course after 10-15 min she literally just threw the basket on our table quickly walked away, without asking if we wanted to order an appetizer...we wait FINALLY she comes back we order appetizer and we ordered our entree at the same time. Of course she&#39;s missing again for 20 min, someone else brings out our apps, she doesn&#39;t even bother coming and asking if we needed anything or drink refills absolutely nothing. As we see her attending bigger parties right near us, completely walking by us and ignoring us. Mind you we never tip waiters less then $12 because we know it&#39;s not an easy job, but her loss with her lazy ass. Long story short after waiting about an hour no food. I get up and ask the dirty girl at the front to speak to the manager she goes and gets the manager and Min comes to our table and explain the situation and he says he will look into it and he comes back and says our food is out next, ummmmm ok why did people who came after us get their food? He offers dessert, which made me laugh like why would I want dessert? I came here to eat food. So we wait cuz apparently we are next. I see him on the other side talking to another table, for a good 7 min. My friend approaches him because according to min it was about another 5 minutes. Literally MIN side eyes my friend and runs back to the kitchen completely ignoring my friend. So my friend comes back and we decide let&#39;s wait 5 min and see, we see MR Min in the kitchen talking to the cooks and it was obvious our food was NOT EVEN CLOSE TO READY. I also see the waitress in the back with him not giving a shit about life. We stand up from our seats and we see an employee walking by, I ask her to speak to the manager because it&#39;s been over an hour now we haven&#39;t received our food, Danielle was so nice about the situation and apologized even though it was NOT her fault at all and said that an another table had an issue that he was taking care of but I told her we are going to leave as we are starving.So my friend goes back again and as soon as MIN was about to run off to the back my friend yells loudly Excuse meeeee and my friend says we don&#39;t want the food we are leaving, so MR min says are you sure it&#39;s almost ready (bullshit) so my friend says no we don&#39;t want it! So we walk away and I go back and see him standing and I ask what his name was and he didn&#39;t not even once acknowledge the situation or apologize. I don&#39;t know who hires these type of people to run such big businesses because people like this will make these places shut down soon or later. Absolutely horrible horrible service and horrible dirty employees. Corporate WILL be hearing from me!!!! And just a side note, it was NOT busy at all!<br>Never ever again and I will make sure to let people know about this!

Out of the locations in Houston, I consider this the worst I&#39;ve been to. I came here for my birthday dinner. Normally I go to Galleria or Sugarland. Service was not great at Memorial, the waitress was confused and unsure of anything that was asked of her. Couldn&#39;t even get our drink orders correct, without another waitress coming to confirm. The ONE menu item I go to the Cheesecake Factory for was discontinued. Chicken Di Pana. I went specifically for my birthday to eat this dish. Little disappointing out of the 500 page menu they don&#39;t have the one like, but of course could make it for me at an additional upcharge.  Didn&#39;t even receive whatever their birthday dessert is. Overall, worst birthday dinner experience ever. Won&#39;t be going back. No discount, no coupon, no free dessert, nothing special done for your bday. No thanks Cheesecake Factory, I will go spend my paycheck elsewhere. SMH

One of my favorite dishes from this restaurant <br>Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo + ( Bacon &amp; Mushrooms) ordered it for take out, pasta didn&#39;t have enough sauce, a little dry for my taste. But still good. definitely visiting soon

Service is bad   Seems they give you a reasonable estimate of wait time just to string you along. 20-25 min seems like a reasonable time to wait but in actuality it&#39;s more of an hour wait. But since you&#39;ve invested 40 minutes of your life what&#39;s another 20?  Right?  LOL<br><br>Setting realistic expectations should be part of the service of a good restaurant.

45 minute wait to get seated for a party of 3 and 2 kids(including my mom who got tired of standing around). 15 minutes went by after the buzzer went off. i even asked if i need to go back outside. the wait staff conveniently dropped the time sticker with my name on the floor and grabbed the menus for another 4 top. Manager on floor felt this was a funny situtation as she could not avoid smirking and was unapologetic.<br>Galleria location is much better in comparison to this.<br>:edit: drove to galleria location got seated in less than 10 minutes.!!

I should have looooooong reviewed TCF!  I go here at least 3/4x a month.  We go here on our own, we come for team lunches...I&#39;m no stranger to this place.<br><br>I love many things about TCF; the atmosphere; especially the patio on a chill day!  The service has never failed me and the cheesecake damn sho never fails.  The food sometimes does, the salmon and shrimp scampi combo really failed me but that&#39;s later.<br><br>As far as the apps, I&#39;ve tried the avocado egg rolls and the fried cheese.  I wouldn&#39;t bother with either; over priced, not worth it and most importantly, not all that good.<br><br>My go to dish is always the lemon herb roasted chicken: half a chicken + carrots + mashed potatoes.  All delicious but if you&#39;re not a lemony person, I wouldn&#39;t get this.<br><br>I&#39;ve tried the salads; the lunch portions are huge, you honestly can share them $5pp....cheap lunch.  They can be rather bland though :( womp womp the bbq chicken really wasn&#39;t on point; the cobb is decent but ask for extra dressing.<br><br>I&#39;ve had a few other OK dishes; shrimp platter, chicken maderia...legit no major complaints but then comes the salmon and shrimp scampi which was surprisingly bland for $20! This food made me uber sick...I&#39;m talking running to the bathroom multiple times sick.  It was not pretty in the least! If that was my first time going, I would have never returned to this place no matter what but I can guarantee I&#39;m not ordering any seafood from here again!!!!!!!!!<br><br>The wheat bread is the only one I eat....swoons and drools!<br><br>Now the most important reason for coming, the actual cheesecake. Kahlua cocoa coffee is my ultimate favorite; can&#39;t nothing or no other flavor beat it.  The strawberry is legit; the blueberry (why would anyone order this but the nut jobs I work with did and it was just ok), the oreo dream is good and the smore&#39;s is up there close second to the kahlua...effin delicious as well.  Both of those are entirely too rich; no point eating in one sitting!<br><br>Speaking of bathrooms; they really should invest in some hand napkins! I hate those put your hands in here and I&#39;ll blow the water off devices.  I don&#39;t touch bathroom doors; who is still doing that in 2013! TCF needs to get with it...bump that paper conservation bullshiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit!

Today is Monday June 4, 2018 at around 2:30pm. My wife and I walked in and the place was not even half full, maybe 30% at the most, lots and lots of empty tables everywhere. The lunch rush was over. On a Monday. We are greeted by a hostess who was honestly, antisocial at best, if not rude. No smile, no greeting, just &#34;How many?&#34; I&#39;m sorry, called me old fashioned, but I think the host or hostess should be someone who is a warm charismatic individual that makes you feel welcomed as you walk a restaurant. The more expensive the restaurant, the more strongly I feel about it. This lady (petite stuck up Hispanic girl), made us feel about as welcome as being at the DMV. This woman took about 3-4 tables ahead of us and when we asked her what gives, she tells us that there were still another 5 tables in line before us. I tell you, when we walked in there were only about 3 tables TOTAL that were waiting ahead of us. <br><br>We finally get a seat and it&#39;s a big table with six place settings. NOT ONE SINGLE CLEAN SET OF SILVERWARE out of the six. NOT ONE. If you ask me that is a very bad sign. That means they don&#39;t care about cleanliness. And miss You Had One Job Hostess together with a lack of general cleanliness and a 15 minute wait in a mostly empty restaurant almost three hours after the lunch rush on a Monday SCREAMS poor management. If you like Cheesecake Factory, do yourself a favor. Go to the Galleria or Woodlands.

My sister, my infant, and I were the first ones seated right at 11am at opening. Minutes later, a waitress seated her son/nephew/whoever right next to us in the booth, so we could babysit! Very unprofessional. I understand sometimes you can&#39;t help if your child has to come to your place of work for an emergency, but she should have sat him elsewhere. She said &#34;these people look nice you can sit here&#34;.  She told the boy (about 9 years old) not to touch the baby and to be nice to us. The boy was well behaved and it was not his fault, but I was appalled by the waitresses behavior. We were having adult conversations and were rudely interrupted by her attempt to have us babysit. The servers at this location were all unprofessional and it was like sitting in a barn house overhearing their conversations about the night before and how hungover they were. I remember this being a nice restaurant as a child, but it is proven to be another run down overpriced chain restaurant. The salads were below average in taste and the bread was cold.
Enjoyed my Lasagna Verde the second time around. The first time it was burnt so that&#39;s the reason for the 3 stars. When it&#39;s made right, it&#39;s a very tasty dish!

Dinner out on a school night!  I only come here during the week days, excluding Fridays as it gets really crowded and waits can last up to an hour.<br><br>I have dinner with a former co-worker a few times a year and this is her favorite place.  Vast menu options, really great waitress (forgot her name, but she was super sweet) and really good food for a casual dining spot.<br><br>I ordered the Shrimp Scampi with angel hair pasta and cheesecake to go. Our meal was served hot and tasted really good.

This restaurant provided some of the worst service we have ever had.  We were seated upon arriving.  15 minutes later, we had not seen a server at our table.  Meanwhile, a family of 4 seated next to us (in the bar which was totally inappropriate) were served drinks and placed their orders. Still no server.  20 minutes in, a server finally showed up.  If you value your time, do not waste it here.  There are another 3000 restaurants  awaiting your business.
Mixed feeling. The food quality is not what it use to be. But I still like their cakes

While I usually visit the location in the Woodlands, I sometimes come this locations when I&#39;m in the area. I LOVE Cheesecake Factory but this particular location, it seems as if the wait staff hates their job and doesn&#39;t want to be there. The recent time I went, bread was not brought until after we ordered which seems to be the norm here. Not sure, but at other locations, I usually receive the bread right after we order drinks. We had to ask another waitress for refills and more bread. Also, I&#39;m not sure what the deal is, but every time I&#39;ve come here, it seems as if they cannot get the food of people at the same table to come out together. I had a pizza and salad that came out together which I would have preferred my salad first. But it was almost 6 minutes before my mom received her chicken salad sandwich and salad. How was a pizza ready before a sandwich? After ordering dessert, we paid and ate our dessert and the waitress never came back to see if wanted to take any of our leftovers to go. I had wanted to take the rest of the cheesecake but unfortunately we had to leave the rest of our dessert behind being that the waitress never bothered to come back.<br><br>Tip: Be sure to ask for easy dressing on the salad or get it on the side. They tend to over do it on the dressing.

Love coming to the Cheesecake Factory because there&#39;s always something for everyone as their menu has so many choices; the pasta and seafood dishes are my favorites on their menu, but you can&#39;t go wrong with the meat plates either.   The drinks are always good (I recommend their mojitos), and of course the cheesecakes are to die for - seriously you might go in a diabetic coma.  Overall, a great place to eat &amp; be with family.

Another disappointment at another location here in Texas. I&#39;ve been dining with the Cheesecake Factory for over 20 years primarily in Las Vegas and different locations in California. Our server tried his best to be on top of it but he was burdened with too many tables. We waited 30 minutes for our Factory Burritos and what was really annoying is that it wasn&#39;t that busy, Monday afternoon at 2:45 is when we arrived there and 3:33 is when we were served our plates that were &#34;really HOT &#34; unfortunately our food didn&#39;t match the temperature. Parts of the burritos were cold to Luke warm. Our server fetched the manager and he offered to have our food reheated? I was like no thanks, who wants their food reheated and still wait longer and run the chance of your food tasting off or something. I was not happy at all, he offered to comp them. We ordered 2 desserts and tea bill was $25! But I&#39;m never coming back to this location. The one at the galleria is worse. Next try is The Woodlands

This by far has been The worst experience we have hadl this cheesecake factory. Our waiter is what made the ambience of this place absolutely horrible. We came here to celebrate my brothers birthday and his hamburger it was absolutely hard as a rock. The fries were not crispy. And the rice was mushy and my Miso salmon. They did not offer to see him happy Birthday. I am extremely disappointed in this location as we usually come here for all of our birthdays. Our waiter and managers seem very nonchalant when we told themAbout our concerns. It&#39;s not like we are paying McDonald&#39;s prices. I expect better service from cheesecake factory. Do not come to the cheesecake factory.

I can&#39;t help. I have to say it was worth four stars. After been the first time with the Cheesecake Factory in Boston with good experience. I had to try this one close to our home. We were seated straight away, a waitress was shortly with us after it and our drinks came pretty quickly. Than we ordered the food, which I expected tasty, but wait. The bread came a few minutes after we ordered and when we had finished it the main course came right on time. Even faster than in Boston. Oh , nearly forgot, we had some delicious starter as well.<br>So definitely go for the food. The service was good as well. So that our waitress was only really friendly when we left it cost her some better tip.<br>But it&#39;s her choice. Nothing to do with the Cheesecake Factory. So despite most of the reviews, we had a good time here and as I said. The 4 starts are well earned.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch. Food was adequate, and the serving size was good. The low rating is for the extremely poor service. Our waitress Loretta R, needed a course in time management.

Came in to pick up a to-go order that was already placed. Went to the bar to ask to see if that&#39;s where I needed to pick up my order, the bartender walked past me without even asking if I needed help. Mind you it&#39;s 4 o&#39;clock in the afternoon and it&#39;s not busy at all. I saw another employee come to the bar to fill a water cup and then I asked him where I go to pick up a to-go order. Had I not said anything to him he would&#39;ve carried on as if I wasn&#39;t even standing there. This is my first time at this location and I don&#39;t see myself visiting ever again. It was entirely too slow to be blatantly ignored. To make matters worse it was management that were some of the ones walking past me as if I wasn&#39;t even standing there.

Food was good. Waiter kept forgetting my water and had to wait forever. I ordered the chicken piccata and it was greasy. Bread came out the same time our entree came. We at least got seated right away.

Unfortunately, I did not check these reviews before taking my party of 5 adults to this CF. We arrived before 5, not busy, but steak medallions were over cooked and 2 of our party received their entrees a full 20 mins after the other 3. These things happen, but our server, Alexandra did not jump on it at all. In fact we waited and waited for her to come for our dessert order and by the time she did, we passed and said we were too tired from waiting. This is not like the many CFs I have visited in many cities. Certainly better choices in Houston.

Horrible!  Will never go back!  Took my granddaughter and family for my granddaughters&#39;s birthday.  Our waitress was inattentive, brought all of the food out at different times and brought my old fashioned cheeseburger out plain and dry with no fries.  She forgot the kid&#39;s drinks and I couldn&#39;t get her attention to tell her.  No manager ever checked on us and the restaurant wasn&#39;t so busy that we should have been ignored.  When I have gone there for other birthdays they have sang and brought out the kids a miniature sundae.  Our waitress says to my daughter, you look tired and handed us the check.  It was a terrible experience.  I will not be back!

We arrived for lunch on a weekday. The place was kind of empty, and we were seated promptly. That&#39;s where the good service ended. As soon as we sat down, a huge, green fly landed on the window beside our table. Gross! It was so big and fat and gross, I freaked out and swatted it with a menu! To make matters worse, the silverware was all dirty, the glasses were dirty, and the table was filthy. Apparently the bus boy/girl hits the middle of the table and leaves the sides nasty. We promptly left and went elsewhere. This is the third time I&#39;ve come here and the tables and silverware are filthy. We won&#39;t be back. It&#39;s in a great location, but this particular Cheesecake Factory is nasty as hell. From now on, I&#39;ll stick to the Galleria location.

Bad service! I ordered a nacho plate with sour cream and guacamole on the side, they brought it with it on the top, so i asked them to change it, then they brought it covered with melted cheese to cover the sour cream . And they didnt add the jalapeño and the onions! And it was cold as ice. Ill never come back there again

I heard half priced cheesecake and I got excited, BUT the trip out to Memorial City definitely wasn&#39;t worth saving $4 on cheesecake. <br><br>When we arrived the place was packed, which is too be expected at 7:30 dinner time. We waited 30 minutes for a table for 2 and when our table ready buzzer went off, we waited an additional 10 minutes for the hostesses to seat other tables and finally get to our ticket.<br><br>The waitress was pretty nice. She mentioned her name but not loud or clear enough for me to remember. Her service was fair. Check on our table as much as needed. She only forgot one item and that&#39;s when I requested additional bread for the table. I had to remind her, but it quickly arrived shortly after.<br><br>We sat next to the bar area at a small table along the mirrored back seating. One of my biggest pet peeves at restaurant is having the tables too close together! I could hear the entire conversation being held at the table next to us and I could have enjoyed my dinner a little bit more if I didn&#39;t have to listen to who the young lady was dating and why. <br><br>The food was very mediocre. I&#39;ve had the Buffalo Blast a few times at the Galleria location and had my heart set on getting those, but of course after I order the waitress comes back with disheartening news that they were out. I settled for the chicken parmesan sandwich and I would have been happier with a spicy chicken sandwich form Chickfila. It was unseasoned and came with almost nothing on it. I was so disappointed. The only thing I enjoyed was the wheat table bread. <br><br>I ordered my half priced cheesecake togo and learned a valuable lesson, every deal isn&#39;t always worth it.

Here&#39;s a great tip when dining with a group: GO SOMEWHERE THAT HAS A HUGE MENU. And here&#39;s another tip: if that place happens to offer 35 different kinds of cheesecake, you are an INSTANT hero ;)<br><br>I brought my nieces and nephews here for dinner before catching a movie at the Cinemark around the corner. The kids had a great time collectively choosing appetizers in addition to their entrees; however, while most of what we had was very good, there were some misses...<br><br>Appetizers:<br>Fried Calamari was very crispy and seasoned well. Accompanying sauces (marinara and tarter) were great compliments. Cheesecake Factory always does a great job with this app. Fried zucchini was just &#34;ok,&#34; and was heavy on the breading. Chicken lettuce wraps were terrific... fresh, crisp, savory, and very flavorful.<br><br>Entrees:<br>Our table had 5 different burgers and a pasta dish. Burger standouts were the Mac and Cheese Burger (she ooooohed and ahhhhed while eating it,) the Mushroom Burger, and my house fave, the Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger. The others (Old Fashioned and The Factory) were simply, &#34;meh&#34; according to the two who ordered them. The one pasta eater said that her Bistro Shrimp Pasta was &#34;pretty good,&#34; but she would definitely order something different next time.<br><br>Dessert:<br>6 different cheesecakes were ordered, and all 6 received glowing reviews!

Only giving 2 stars because the cheesecake is good. However the food and service has absolutely sucked every time I&#39;ve gone here. Waiters stand around chatting with other waiters and take forever to come and greet you and take your order, the first time I went they were out of so many things such as straws, butter for the bread, the burger I ordered. Second time I went the service sucked yet again, waiter didn&#39;t forgot to give me a menu and then got my appetizer order wrong but I was to tired to correct them, tried the fettuccine Alfredo and oh lord I took two bites and wanted to puke, the noodles were so over cooked and were very bland and gummy, there was very little Alfredo sauce. This place is too overpriced when they have crappy food and crappy service. I will not be coming back

This was a very bad 1st time experience. The wait time was awful. First the hostess told my party and I to come back in 20 minutes to get a beeper. Came back in 20 minutes then we waited 1hour for table. I normally would leave but my daughter really wanted celebrate her birthday there and by then it was after 9:00 pm. All places nearby were closing. I went back to host several times and she told me only one person ahead of me, it would be just a moment. <br>Why would the restaurant lie? It was clear at the end the hostess was seating people not based on entry time. The waiter did his best in the circumstances. Silverware was placed on bare table. Bread was tough.<br><br> That was my first time and last time.<br><br>The menu selection consisted of meat and mashed potatoes or rice selections. Didn&#39;t live up to the hype.

So late sun night, ordered online at 10:15, said it would be ready at 10:35, got here 10:40, waited in line that didn&#39;t really move because even though there where 5 people standing around, they weren&#39;t the &#34;to go&#34; person tonight...  finally got to counter and my food wasn&#39;t ready, they where &#34;packing it&#34;, which meant I got to wait for another 25 min, then they brought it and didn&#39;t bring bread or the forks I asked for online.  Then I got to wait another bit for some bread.  All in all, 50 min from order to walk out.  Could have just sat down and gotten served faster...  they need more help at to go.  Need to learn customer service, never have an employee when asked for help scoff and say,&#34;I don&#39;t do the food&#34;, then what do you do here at this restaurant that only does food????  Offer people a water, coke, etc if you make them stand around and wait for 30 min past when their order was supposed to be ready, these simple things make the difference.  I was reminded why I don&#39;t frequent these mega chains much.  Local is better.   Oh, in addition to not giving me three medallions, I asked for medium, and got three very well done pieces of jerky and shriveled vegetables...

I would give this location a 5 star review, however the service wasn&#39;t as amazing as it could be. <br>I will always love Cheesecake Factory for their abundance of options, portions, and the aesthetics of the food. The food is never disappointing.<br>The atmosphere is incredible, I always go with my home girls outside when the weather is nice and dine like there&#39;s no tomorrow. <br>The problem I&#39;m having with this location is an inconsistency of quality service. <br>We were not attended to periodically and almost felt as if we had to call a waiter every single time instead of being assisted every 15-or-so minutes. <br>We didn&#39;t get bread, refills, or menus without having to ask. It wasn&#39;t much of a hassle, but more of an inconvenience. <br>This, however, will not stop me from dining at this location since it is closer to where I live, and I enjoy eating here after I shop with some friends.

Stopped by to pickup a slice of chocolate fudge cake.  They put it a container which is too small so when you open the container the whole upper layer of chocolate fudge peels off and sticks to the top of the container.<br><br>Very disappointing considering you pay $9 for a slice of cake.

I wrote a review on another site about the poor quality service we received last Sunday. I got a reply from the mgt team making me feel like my complaint was not valid and it was just the fact the we were hungry! If that would be the case then I would write bad reviews for every place I go eat! I just want to say that I will never go there again and make sure I tell everybody I know not to go. I sure was a waste of money and time!

NEVER AGAIN! They told me it would be a 2 and a half hour wait for a party of 10. There wasn&#39;t many people waiting. Party of 7 walks in and they get seated right away. We came to Pappasitos and there was a tone of people waiting. They told us there was a 30 minute wait. This was my first time at this Cheesecake Factory location and I will NOT be back.

This was my first time at the Cheesecake Factory and I don&#39;t want to say my experience was bad but it was definitely not my favorite place. We started with Long Island Iceteas and were alright. We thought we ordered the artichoke dip and crab dip for appetizers which took longer than expected so we felt rushed to eat it since food showed up. She picked Shrimp Alfredo which was over cooked and mushy. We couldn&#39;t eat that. My plate was bow ties with sauce and chicken and mushrooms which was very good but she was bringing extra sauce and it took a long time since she accidentally spilled the sauce. We never got the Parmesan cheese we asked for. The manager came Over and apologized and got us a cheesecake on the house which was nice but when she walked away, my friend&#39;s son was laying on the booth and when he sat up he scratched his arm. So then another manager came over and bandaged his arm. We got the cheesecake and told them we were in a hurry at this point because it took so long for everything and they were going to box everything up which then they disappeared and it&#39;s like they forgot about it. Finally we get the bill and the boxed foods and they messed up the receipt and left the Alfredo that was sent back on it... lol it was a basic shitshow and storm of mistakes.  Plus side is, everyone was nice and we got at least the cheesecake on the house... Not sure I will go back though. First impressions mean a lot to me.

Horrible service from the manager. My family came to visit this location to celebrate Mother&#39;s day at 12:30 and did not fully eat our meal until 3:00. My brother and his wife had to wait for at least 45 minutes to receive part of their meal that did not originally come out with their plate. My mom&#39;s shrimp scampi had NO flavor what so ever! After speaking to the manager the only thing she had to offer was cheesecake instead of offering to comp the meals that were incorrect. 50% of the table had to send food back due to lack of flavor and food being cold because of waiting for certain items that didn&#39;t make it on the plate. Unacceptable!

Very poor service. Took us 30 minutes to get water and 10 just for her greet us. Our server was Breyana and she was barely visible. We kept ordering appetizers but they were out of the stuff we ordered so I guess to save herself some time she brought us a printed list of everything they were out of and said &#34;here look at this before you order,&#34; I felt like we were an inconvenience when it was them who didn&#39;t have the food items. Always used to come to this location because the one off of 610 was terrible, now this one is no different. The busser who cleaned the 3 tables surrounding us kept digging in his nose, he wasn&#39;t discreet at all. Won&#39;t be coming back for a while.

I normally come here for lunch since it&#39;s cheaper but saw a movie and came for drinks and dinner this time around. I split the shrimp and chicken pasta with a friend and had a mai tai (they ran out of red wine for the sangria I wanted originally). Our server was very nice but came around too often for my comfort. It&#39;s not necessary to hover, I&#39;ll tip you no matter what. The food was great and the atmosphere was nice, though a little too dark in my opinion. We had a couple sitting to our left and a family celebrating a birthday on our right. What I don&#39;t understand is that they give you a free ice cream for your birthday but not cheesecake. What a disappointment. The bread is unlimited which I like since they have amazing bread.

I have to say, this cheese cake factory is getting worse year by year. We sat out in the patio. The serve lead us to our table and boy the table looked crappy!!! Just imagine you are spending over $12 for each plate and then you are seated in an I cleaned table??? Just a disgrace and terrible, I mean WTF!!! This will be my last!

Group of 9 were seated. On Thursday April 6th. <br><br>We had a wonderful waiter who was very friendly and nice. He took our order no problem. <br><br>Chicken nachos, shrimp scampi, two kids spaghetti, and kids pizza and chicken teriyaki.<br><br>Chicken nachos were on point, sooo very good.<br>The shrimp scampi was tiny and had very little portion to it. (My brother was still hungry after he ate it all). The kids spaghetti were plentiful and had lots to share. The kids pizza was burnt and had to be sent back (was recooked and was fine the second time). The chicken teriyaki was a HUGE portion. Lots of food but was very good. <br><br>We ordered cheesecake (of course) Hershey&#39;s, Tiramisu, Hazelnut and callow carb with strawberries. We left happy. <br><br>Four hours later, about 1-2 am... 6 out of 9 of us got food poisoning. Our whole Friday was ruined as no one wanted to eat or do anything since being up late throwing up their &#34;lovely&#34; meals. Not sure what happened.. but  eat are your own risk.

I wt at CF all the time at home in Maryland.  This location has very bad service.   The hosts at the front were not friendly.  Yes there was a crowd but they were border lone rude.  We got to the table and our server was not very friendly either.  She had an obvious disposition not conducive to customer service.  The food we ordered came out wrong and we had to remind her that we ordered it a certain way.  She didn&#39;t like that too much.  We finally called the manager over who seemed indifferent as well.  Note to self:  do not go back here!   When we told her that we had her bad reviews about this location she told us she knew it but had an indifferent attitude about it.

My parents&#39; were in town and they had gift cards for this place so I decided to check it out since I love cheesecake. It wasn&#39;t too busy on a weekend evening. I ordered a bacon bacon cheeseburger which I had cooked to medium and it was good. I wish I ordered something smaller though to save room for more cheesecake. I ordered a slice of Godiva cheesecake and it was so creamy and good. Our waiter, forgot his name, was friendly and always checked on us.

Waiting for a table took about 40minutes which is totally reasonable because we had a party of 10 . The food was 3/5, the Louisiana Chicken Pasta is better at the Galleria location. The service seemed good at the beginning but then our server disappeared &amp; only came back to give us the check . which he then made mistakes on them, which I think could have been avoided if they had check presenters specially when handling multiple transactions on 1 table.

So I like Cheesecake Factory..usually..not this location though. We got Buffalo Blast, Tex Mex Egg rolls and Fries. It took about 10 minutes to finally get recognized that we haven&#39;t been served. Got our drinks about 10 minutes AFTER placing the drinks. Bread took another 5 minutes after our water. So 25 minutes in, we had bread and water. We placed our order and waited another 15 minutes and eventually got to eat. Food looked good, but looks can be deceiving. The Egg Rolls smelt rotten and tasted rotten, so we talked to the manager and he took care of it. I hate to say it, but I got a horrible vibe from the moment I walked in...maybe because I was white...sucks to say but the employees seemed to look and treat me differently unlike other tables. <br><br>If this location was the only food available, I&#39;d rather starve then have to go back..<br><br>ONLY PLUS TO THIS LOCATION WAS THE MANAGER.

I know, I know Cheesecake Factory is a chain. But they still have the best and widest selection of cheesecake that I&#39;ve experienced up to this point. And, their expansive dinner menu can accommodate almost anyone! Sorry foodies! <br>I&#39;ve only been to this Cheesecake Factory four times. And can only clearly recall three, thanks alcohol!<br><br>The first time I ordered and took it Togo:<br>Hershey&#39;s chocolate cheesecake 4/5<br><br>The second time I ordered and ate on patio:<br>App- Avocado egg rolls 4/5, absolute delish and would get again, but I wish they were crispier.<br>Main 1- Filet mignon 4.5/5, how is it so good?<br>Main 2- Chicken Madeira+Steak Dianne 3/5,<br>Meh.<br>Drinks- Passion tea 5/5, Long Island 3.5/5, Classic Mojito 4/5<br>Dessert- Classic with Strawberry cheesecake 4.8/5<br>Service- 3.5/5<br><br>The third time I ordered and ate on patio:<br>App- Eggroll Sampler 4/5<br>Main 1- Kobe burger 4.7/5 OMG YUM<br>Main 2- Honey Truffle Chicken 1.1/5, where is the truffle? Where is the sauce? This tastes like dry hospital food. I literally cannot believe I paid for this.<br>Drinks- Passion tea 5/5, Long Island 2.5/5, too much coke; Pineapple mojito 3.5/5, good but a little too sweet for my taste.<br>Dessert- Classic with  cheesecake <br>Service- 4.5/5<br><br>Im surprised by some reviews, maybe the service is better on the patio? <br>All in all I will go back, and sit on the patio! I wish 3.5 was an option because the &#34;Honey Truffle&#34; Chicken is absolutely ridiculous. But I&#39;ll give a four because four of the dishes I tried were almost perfect.
7/15/15<br>Celebrated a friends birthday there. Very pleasant atomasphere.  Staff was friendly &amp; our waiter was great and polite. Would recommend coming here to this location.

Came here (Memorial City location) for lunch and the service was horrible. It took 10-15 mins just to bring waters back to the table and another 10 mins to come back and take our orders and 40 mins for the food to come out! The waiter wasn&#39;t friendly at all and when he did eventually come back to our table after the above mentioned times, he rushed us. Pretty sure we never even got his name or a welcome. <br><br>To top off this experience, as I&#39;m transferring the rest of my pasta (I didn&#39;t eat very much of it - curse of waiting too long to eat and filling up on juice and water) to my to go plate, I see a bug at the bottom. It was under the food: sauce and once moved it crawled around and he plate. I showed the waiter, he took the plate to he manager. The manager came, said &#34;I&#39;m sorry for the inconvenience, I&#39;ll have them look into it&#34;. That&#39;s it?!? What are they looking into? Hopefully cleaning their dirty kitchen! <br><br>Terrible experience!

Shaniqua* was so great and helpful in working with me to pick the right assortment of cheesecake for my mom&#39;s birthday! She took her time to explain all the flavors and her recommendations helped us so much. Lisa was great too! Awesome staff representing Cheesecake Factory!

Service was a little off today, (must have been a bad day), but other than that everything else was amazing. We ordered a couple appetizers that were delicious. Not to mention I just found out they have brunch on Sunday&#39;s so I&#39;ll definitively will have to check it out. I left there far full and satisfied :)

First time at this location was a memorable one: I had the cheesecake for the first time ... I&#39;m crazy. <br><br>Lemon Garlic Shrimp from the Skinny Menu (4/5) Very good, but of course, since it was off the skinny menu, it was small. Four stars bc my friend ordered the same thing from the skinny menu and almost got triple the amount of food that I got. Not a fan of inconsistency. <br><br>Tiramisu Cheesecake (10/5) !!!!!!!!!! OHMYGAWD!!!!! Desserts from God himself ... Wowowowow <br><br>I&#39;d give this place 5 star rating if I was judging based on cheesecake, but the service was a little poor.

This particular Cheesecake Factory is pretty slow on service guys. It was just me and one other person and we waited for maybe ten minutes for a waiter to even show up and ask us what drinks we wanted. I also feel like the timing of the appetizer/entree was way off. It all got there at the same time and granted it isnt the waiters fault necesarily but still I did notice he had a few tables and didnt make it to kitchen to drop off our initial order for the appetizer in time. He was real cool though and perhaps he was new so that could explain the slower service. This location really needs to hire better hostesses thats for sure. The girls working here are uninviting and unwelcoming. I had to say HI loudly in order to get these girls to stop their conversation and acknowledge me. That was totally awkward for me to have to do and unnecessary period. The parking is always normally a nightmare here so be prepared to valet or have shitty parking. <br>For food choices I always recommend the eggrolls for an appetizer and any noodle dish is usually pretty good. Chicken madeira is also a tasty entree.

Horrible service and food. I ordered the brunch combo. My pancakes came out pretty much raw. I then notified my server and she brought me a menu to pick out another item. I then ordered the regular burger medium well. It took over 20 minutes to receive this item while my girlfriend was already finished with hers. When I did finally get my meal, it was burnt like inedible burnt. The manager came over and asked was there anything else I would like. I told him no and I ended up getting food from somewhere else once we left. Im not a fan of Cheesecake Factory in general but we were in a hurry to grab brunch somewhere close. I will not return.

Massive portions just about 3 minutes or so after our orders went in.... microwave much?<br><br>The cheesecakes slices were delicious but the food and service were awful. I never really care much for reviews but I don&#39;t think we enjoyed our experience. Waitress couldn&#39;t care less, borderline unprofessional.

Cheese cake factory has always been one of my fav restaurants. The food is amazing, the ambiance is relaxing and the service has been great. I wanted to try the oreo cheesecake but was so full from dinner. The portions are pretty big! Will definitely come back again!

Compared to other locations I&#39;ve eaten at this location was the worst. The only good thing about my visit here was the style of this restaurant, where they have a fancy outside patio area you can choose if you don&#39;t want to dine inside. The waiter was okay but the food was prepared awful. I ordered the Herb Crusted Salmon, which is usually my go to order so I know how it&#39;s should taste. This time it was not appetizing! The mashed potatoes were not mashed and was mostly just hard blocks. The broccoli was over cooked and my salmon was cold. Definitely will not be returning to this location!

We usually enjoy ourselves when it comes to this place. We endure the no parking and waiting for a table. But maybe they were having a bad day today. The waitress did say they had very little waiters today. We went in with three adults an three children (1 in a high chair). They sat us right behind the waiter station where my baby had to be passed by with hot food and drinks and very heavy foot traffic. I asked the lady if it was going to be ok sitting here with a high chair and if it was going to be in the way, trying to hit to maybe move us? She said no it would be fine. The waitress dropped a tray of dishes right behind my baby nearly missing her, she did say she was trying not to hit the baby. But at the same time I had just mentioned maybe this isn&#39;t a good place for this particular party. They brought our drinks all at different times, they said they were waiting on the bartender. Ok no big deal, it&#39;ll give us more time to decide. After ordering our meals all came out at different times. The kids ate first and then got fussy when waiting for the adults to eat their food that was brought out late. Then another adults plate was brought out and they&#39;re in a rush to eat because everyone is ready to leave. It just really seemed unorganized and chaotic today. So today I rate them 3 stars. Hope all the employees have a better day.

First time ever visiting The Cheesecake Factory and will never return again. The waitress looked at me and my sister in disgust and was very rude and only took our drink order. We did not receive our drinks until 20 minutes later. After that she had another waitress take over for her which much more kinder and professional. However, our food did not arrive until 30 minutes after ordering and the food itself was very disappointing and not very good. The only good thing about this place is the cheesecake. Everything from the food to the staff is terrible. Will not return again.

Ordered lemon piccata to be delivered via door dash.  The entree is made with chicken, lemon, capers and sauce.  By far the worst lemon piccata I&#39;ve ever had.  Not one, nada, no capers in the meal.  Lid wasn&#39;t secure so most of the caperless sauce was in the bag.  Two stars for the bread.  Poor service, no quality check, never would have happened if dining in.  They should treat the to go orders with better quality checks,  ate this same meal in Dallas, terrible in Houston .

I have tried to place orders over the phone multiple times and they always put me on hold. Every time I get put on hold it&#39;s over 15 minutes. And what&#39;s the worst part...they forget to answer the phone because it is too busy. I ended up getting frustrated. May Be have online ordering if this doesn&#39;t work out. I go to the westheimer location even it&#39;s further because they are more professional.

Haven&#39;t eaten here in years and I must say the food was ok. I ordered the Fresh grilled salmon and it was ok, I&#39;ve had better. My mom has the lasagna (vegetarian pasta) and she loved it. One of my daughters had a bacon cheeseburger and her bacon was so burnt they had to remake the bacon (her burger was getting cold while she waited). My other daughters ordered chicken tenders and she loved them. My sister ordered falafel pasta and she didn&#39;t like it at all, she sent it back and shared chicken tenders with my daughter. I also had the &#34;Georgia Peach&#34; and it was very good. My daughters ordered cheese cake and it was really good. Overall rating of three stars. Based on my current experience I will not return. If I did maybe I would try something different, meh.
Ordered the tiramisu cheesecake and the cappuccino. Love the cheesecake. The atmosphere was ok. Crowded as always. Sat at the bar, the lady who assisted us very friendly .

Waited 20 minutes for a waiter to come. Got fed up and left. Didn&#39;t even get our drinks. Other people who came after us got their drinks and appetizers. Ridiculous services there. Go to Olive Garden across the I 10 for better and quicker service.

We were seated within 5 minutes when they told us it&#39;s a 30 minute wait which was awesome. Our waitress was really nice. I wish I remembered her name. The steak was really good. My dad&#39;s pizza came out burned and they gladly replaced it. We waited almost 30 minutes for our food to come out so waiting for a replacement pizza took even longer. We got complimentary chicken vegetable soup which was delicious since our pizza came out burned. My husband enjoyed his burger. Overall it was a decent experience. We love The Cheesecake Factory, so we will  be back!
A few hiccups but everything turned out well . Couldn&#39;t order our favorites due to short staff and bad weather.

Located near the Memorial City Mall ; parking spots enough.<br><br>Normally we avoid The Cheesecake Factory (not happy at all with their food) but we decided to give it a chance (better than going to the foodcourt).<br>We ordered an Asian Pear Martini (11.25 dollar) and a Strawberry Martini (11.25 dollar). Drinks were fine but too small for this price !<br>I decided to go for the Lunch Cheese pizza with a caesar salad (13.95 dollar) and my husband had the pasta carbonara with chicken (16.50 dollar).<br>The pizza : nothing special at all. I can make it better at home. My husband asked for a lunch dish (which is smaller) but he good the normal one... taste : just OK.<br>We ended with a café latte (4.50 dollar) and an original piece of cheesecake (6.95 dollar). I&#39;m sure that once the cheesecakes were very good there, but now... sorry.... that can be much better !<br><br>We paid 70 dollar (excl tip) which is too much for the quality of food.

The service was great but the food was terrible. Our drinks and bread came out rather quickly. We ordered the egg rolls as an appetizer and they were very greasy. I ordered chicken enchiladas. The rice and beans both needed a significant amount of salt and the chicken was too salty.

Ordered take out here! Had a great experience and our food was delicious! We ordered:<br>A<br>-Thai chicken wraps<br>-side of fries<br>-chix bbq ranch salad <br>-Jamaican shrimp plate <br>-side geeen tossed salad <br><br>Everything was very good! When I got there, food was already waiting for me. The manager saw I was waiting and rushed over to help me. He double checked my order and was very prompt in checking me out. The gal working the counter was very friendly too, making sure I had everything I needed. <br><br>Will definitely come back and get my cheesecake fix too!

The food of course is always delicious, but the service at this location is embarrassing. We went around 3pm and there were only 4 or 5 other tables. Our server was particularly bad. She got our drink orders. Disappeared for a while. Came back and told us they were waiting on the bread they normally bring to the table. She got our food orders. Disappeared for I kid you not 10-15 minutes more. Never gave us bread or even explained why she didn&#39;t. She brought out meals out... then disappeared forever. She must have left, but never even said bye or asked us how our meal was... no one came by to ask us if we needed anything then 25 minutes later another girl gave us the check... we had to literally get up and find a server to finish paying. The Cheesecake Factory is awesome, but this location is severely lacking. The managers should be ashamed and have better training. Managers are a reflection of their workers so find new managers.

Pretty much my worse experience with Cheesecake Factory. Took over 30 minutes after ordering to get food. The waitress came by only once to refill drinks. My super simple Cobb salad was awful. Old lettuce, burnt bacon, weird eggs and brown avocado. Super disappointed.

I like Cheesecake Factory... but not so much this one in Memorial City. <br><br>I went with my wife and two kids for a Saturday night dinner. We arrived at the mall and, of course, could&#39;t find a parking spot after driving around for 15 minutes. So, we ended up paying $10 for valet... that&#39;s right, $10. <br><br>After finally making it into the restaurant, we should have just left at that point... it was sweltering hot in there, which we found out later was due to the fact that the restaurant&#39;s main A/C unit was broken. But, we were looking forward to some CF food all week, so we stuck it out. The hostess told us the wait would be about 20-30 minutes. It was over an hour... waiting in the sweltering heat. <br><br>As we were waiting to be seated, I couldn&#39;t help but look around... and I was not real keen on the crowd that was in the restaurant. There were people there in wife-beaters and flip flops... just seemed trashy. <br><br>I will say that the wait staff was excellent... the bartender that waited on us for the hour before we were finally seated was pleasant and the waiter we had was very attentive and nice. <br><br>The food was ok, and really just not as good as I&#39;ve had at other locations. For the main course, I had the chicken chipotle pasta. It was pretty tasty, but lacking in a few areas... the asparagus, for instance, was clearly undercooked. I had to eat around it and then found myself wishing that they had made it correctly becuase the dish lacked without it. <br><br>We were so uncomfortable, we ended the dinner abruptly and skipped out on the cheesecake... I doubt we will ever return to this location. <br><br>BOTTOM LINE: Not the best Cheesecake Factory... I would drive out to the Woodlands or to the Galleria locations before returning to this one.

Noo, Noo, Nooo, &amp; Noooo. The cheesecake was fine. I prefer Juniors but it was fine. What I don&#39;t understand is whyyyyy in the world it took 13 minutes for you to pack up my cheesecake, put it in a box , put it in a bag, and hand it to me?? Especially since I already paid for it. <br>No, instead I had to wait on the side while this man picked up the phone, took other customers, retrieved their items and handed it to them first, checked on other employees, went back to talk to other employees again, picked up the phone some more, took more customers and handed them their items, all the while I stood there waiting. <br>After 10 minutes had passed, I asked him how much longer it would be and his response: &#34;oh we just have to prepare it and add some cream to the top&#34; -HOLY GOOD GOD- seriously???? THIS WAS NOT WORTH 13 MINUTES OF MY TIME. Maybe this is how they roll down south? Either way, didn&#39;t appreciate him or his demeanor.
Skeptical of this location because of the reviews but I had no problems. Great apps, food and drinks are exactly what we were craving.

Whoa what a wait to sit down at this place! My friend asked her guests to attend a birthday dinner here with reservations at 8PM. I rushed from my side of town to get to the restaurant exactly at eight because I know how it feels to wait for dinner guests when you&#39;re hungry.  However, we did not get a table until 9.  Why such the delay???? Because CF does not take reservations!  I was highly surprised by this since Grand Lux Cafe in the Galleria takes reservations and they are a sister company of The Cheesecake Factory. From what my friend told me, she knew about there being no reservations, but she arrived early to request a table and she was told that getting a table inside the restaurant  would demand at least a TWO HOUR WAIT!<br><br>Must be a joke--not even feasible. Instead they told her they could get a table for her on the patio--it just needed to be cleaned up. I guess the cleaning supplies was stolen by the Tooth Fairy because we still were not seated until 9. and guess where we ended up being seated?<br><br>Inside. By the bar. They finally used their heads and pushed some bar tables together to accommodate our group. Only problem with bar tables are the high as a kite bar seats. I felt like a pregnant woman in her final trimester trying sit in the chair and scoot it up close enough to sit at the table comfortably. It was a struggle!!! <br><br>At this point, I was pretty much over the desire to dine at CF. I had perused the menu before I came to save time, but nothing really enticed my taste buds. After the wait, all I needed was a glass of water and complimentary bread and butter to make it to my next destination. <br><br>Seriously, CF needs to consider some sort of reservation system. We came on a Friday night, which is going to be busy. However, their sister company Grand Lux, has a steady flow of patrons and allows them to reserve seating--giving them 15 minutes grace before releasing the table. They&#39;re not losing business with a reservation system. CF could use the same protocol to give patrons a chance to dine at their establishment as well. Until then, I believe I&#39;ll pass on dining at Cheesecake Factory for awhile.

First time here for social hour, and it was wonderful not only was our server amazing and so attentive, the manager also came over to make sure everything was up to par. The service was exceptional great. The food and drinks were also delicious. Will definitely be coming back.

Okay...one question comes to mind about this place...what is up with all the flies in the building?!?  Thankfully, the flies stayed on the windows and on the glass that separates the kitchen area from the dining area, but that is still pretty bad.  I may have given this place 4 stars if I did not see so many frickin&#39; flies!<br><br>I went on Mother&#39;s Day, so you know that a considerable wait was going to happen.  No problem there.  The menu is quite extensive with a lot of variety, so no problem there at all.  Given that the establishment was so packed, I expected some mistakes to happen, and our server got about 90% of our order correct, so no problems there.  of course, the decor in the place is really nice, so no problems there.<br><br>Food...portion sizes are plentiful, so no problems there.  Taste of the food...well...what is this?  Wait, a chain restaurant that actually uses seasoning, definitely not a problem there!  Very tasty dishes, and after you scour through many options, that can be overwhelming for fence straddlers, you can rest assured that the descriptions of the dishes are true to form.  <br><br>I would have to mention that considering that they are known for cheesecake, I would like for this place to do one of two things.  Either they should make the slices of cheesecake bigger, or lower the cost of the cheesecake.  Better yet, they need to offer a sampler platter where you can get between 5 - 10 2&#34; squares of cheesecake so you can try a huge variety of them every time you visit the place.<br><br>I could definitely go into the specifics of my dishes that I ordered, but that seems pointless.  Know these things:<br><br>1.  The decor of the place is nice.<br><br>2.  The staff is attentive and professional.<br><br>3.  There is a huge variety of options, EVEN WHEN ORDERING APPETIZERS!  What do I mean by that you may be thinking.  You have an appetizer section, then you have a subsection of appetizers, which is a mini-section of the appetizers...like a sampler&#39;s special or plate!  Check the on-line menu to see what I mean.<br><br>4.  The portion size of entrees is definitely plentiful.  The pricing of the food items are workable...not cheap food, but no where near expensive food.<br><br>5.  You will find a cheese cake that you like...PERIOD!  Great variety of flavors available.<br><br>Do yourself a favor and try this place out.
Good lunch specials, good service and very tasty drinks (thanks Bianca). The atmosphere was nice and quaint.
Ate here today.  waitress was wonderful...great atmosphere had a chicken salad it was good and carrot cake cheesecake was great!!

The worst experience ever! It started from the hostess who acted like it was a burden to seat us outside.. very very rude. Throughout our dinner we never had one consistent waiter.. a different person took our drink order a different person took our food order and a different people were bringing out our food. So confusing! Our food took 40 minutes to come out.. and that was just the first plate! They brought out each plate separately and not in the same time frame! We were all done eating ( party if 6) and my husband&#39;s food still didn&#39;t come! He had to eat my left overs and just take his to go. <br><br>A lady came over, I&#39;m assuming the manger to drop off one off one of the dishes. We told her how bad the service was, she didn&#39;t even seem apologetic. Ridiculous!!! The only thing they did was comp my husbands meal. I definitely will not be back!!!

I should have looked at the reviews before coming here. Service was aweful. Right in the door there was NO ONE at the reception desk and we waited for a couple minutes before anyone came back. Our waitress, Courtney M, was not attentive, was very rushed and short with us even though the restaurant was hardly busy. I had an empty glass of water for most of my meal and she never came to ask if the food was ok. The food was bland in my opinion and definately not worth the lack of service we had to endure. I will not be going back to this location.

I have been here one time before, and while I was reluctant to go because of the rating, it was not so bad of an experience, and the food was good in my opinion. Today though, was different though. I&#39;m not too picky of a guy when it comes to how the waiters treat the customer, or if they greet me when I walk in. Those things to me are not review worthy. What is review worthy is when they have such awful service that I just want to tell the whole world not to go there because i had the worst experience and it doesn&#39;t just happen 1 time; like the Wal Mart by my house at 11pm. What is also review worthy to me is when the restaurant or the store go the extra mile for customer service, which was the case today. My sister &amp; I were having a nice casual dinner, and celebrating her birthday. Nothing out of the ordinary. The appetizer was excellent (crab bites), not too picky about food either. Our waiter was very attentive (his name was Nathan, I believe.), and provided the best service possible. We ordered our food, and mine came first. My sister notices hers is taking a little longer, and all of the sudden the manager(she was a blonde lady, I didn&#39;t catch her name.) comes up to us and apologizes and lets us know there was a mix up in the kitchen with my sisters plate, that the order was made wrong, and in result, the chef had to make another plate. The manager not only offered an apology, but she gave us the plate that was wrong to go, also gave my sister a free salad while she waited for the correct dish, and then to seal the deal and her birthday, they blessed us with a free cheesecake on the house. For me, the salad was enough to say I&#39;m sorry. However, this manager and our waiter went the extra mile to make her evening, and my evening one to remember, and to even impact me enough to write this long review. You want to know how the food was? It was great! Don&#39;t take my word for it though, my taste is different from yours.
