All I can say is that I left out of there feeling blessed and praising God for a wonderful night at Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m no one special and sure as heck didn&#39;t deserve that treatment, but it is worthy of mentioning the fact that in this location I received excellent treatment from this staff, it wasn&#39;t the most welcoming, and it wasn&#39;t perfect, but it definitely stood out to me and was definitely more than what I asked for. God bless you all!

This was the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I&#39;ve ever had. Our waitress attended to a table that was sat AFTER us, before us. The other waitress working in the same section as her took care of us before she did by bringing us bread and greeting us. Once our waitress addressed us, we ordered some appetizers and they took over half an hour to come out the kitchen. Right as they came out, we ordered our main entrees and our waitress told us she would be back in 5 minutes because she was nursing. She was nowhere to be found for over 15 minutes. At this point, I grabbed the other girl from before to help me cancel my entree and refill our drinks and bring more bread. After an hour and a half, the one entree we didn&#39;t cancel finally arrived and it was a salmon plate. The food was slimy and bland. We sent it back and spoke to a manager about our awful experience and in return she apologized and offered to remove the salmon from the bill and to give me a complimentary slice of cheesecake. When I got my bill, I was still charged for the cheesecake. I am extremely dissatisfied with my service and upset that we were there TWO HOURS for two small appetizers and one entree.

I wavered between two and three stars.  The food was very good, as always.  I had a farro salad, it&#39;s a small bites plate.  I knew I would be getting and sharing a cheesecake so why waste calories on a nourishing dish when I can squander the calories on a three lb. slice of cheesecake???<br><br>We sat at the bar.  It took a long time for someone to come over. There were so many waitstaff wandering around, looking busy but really they appeared to be just walking to or from someplace, not really DOING anything.  <br><br>Our waiter was okay, the food was good and fresh. My brother got a hamburger that he said it was the best one he has ever had.  He then had a snickers cheesecake which was downright sinful.<br><br>Our waiter left and another waiter took over. He was okay, he forgot a few things and the wait time was long for an extra plate, and he didn&#39;t hand it to us, he just  said, I brought you an extra plate.  And stood there. <br><br>Then came the bathrooms.  They were filthy. My sister came back from an attempt and refused to use the facilities.  She said there was urine all over every seat.  I had to take a look for myself. I went in and there sure enough were droplets of something on the seats.  There was toilet paper on the floor of one stall and both rolls of TP were empty.  This was about 4 PM - how this went unchecked all afternoon is beyond me. <br><br>I decided to take a picture and yelp this, but right then, the toiled burbled and shot up about 8&#34; like Old Faithful.  I stood there looking, and it happened again. That&#39;s what I think the water droplets were on the toilet seats...toilet water. This place needs a plumber to look at their system.  It appears their ventilation or something is way, way off.  <br><br>There was food on the floor as we were leaving. We saw it before we stood up and the waitstaff didn&#39;t see it (or didn&#39;t want to) and they were walking thru it.  We pointed it out and our waiter wiped it up.  It looked pretty greasy, whatever it was and I was concerned for someone whose footing may not be sure.  <br><br>Anyway, the food was pretty good, fresh, yummy and as ordered.  It was the cleanliness of the bathrooms that was such a turn off and the waitstaff didn&#39;t seem to give a darn about much. <br><br>But, lo, the cheesecake calleth.

Worst service ever! They were out of both things I ordered and we got there at 545 pm in order to make a 7 pm Rockets game! Birthday party all food came out different times and my sweetheart finally got her chicken salad sandwich at past 7 pm over 1 hour later! Waiter forgot the order and then lied and said kitchen was backed up. No waters! Drinks not refilled! Food not good , late for game! Terrible waiter and management! I would not go again if I had a big party or in a hurry imo! Joe

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! I went to dinner with my friend. My friend has an visual disability. She can&#39;t see well in the dark. So she uses a white cane. We waited 25 minutes for a table. The host lady who seated us to the table treated my friend like she didn&#39;t exist. I saw the lady have 2 menus in her hand when we walked to our seat. The host didn&#39;t give her a menu for my friend. I asked &#34;Why does she not get a menu?&#34; She gave us a look. Like she didn&#39;t understand what I was asking. I asked again. She just stared. She was probably assuming my friend was fully blind and she didn&#39;t need it. Sigh. This was just wrong.<br><br>I know that ADA laws don&#39;t regulate rudeness or insensitivity of workers. But they should at least train their employees how to deal with disabled individuals. We were so offended! We have never experienced this from any other restaurants before.

Worst service ever!  After being there for 15 mins, no one came and took our drink order, nor did they provide us with a small plate for the bread and butter.  Finally we grabbed a waiter, he said he wasn&#39;t our waiter but took our order.  They brought my enter and brought my friends entree 20 mins after( it was only tacos) . Worst service, I had to tell to restaurant manager to bring his food, and he had to warm up my pasta since it was cold because I was waiting on my friends food to arrive.  Management and staff need some much needed training on Customer service.

Only because we had gift cards did we eat here and wow, they aim to disappoint.  I had better updates and service from the managers apologizing for the long wait on the food than I did the server.  He was nice...when he showed up.  Our food literally came out an hour after ordering it and mine arrived with NONE of the stuff that goes on a steak taco.  Just steak sitting in corn tortilla.  I sent it back and he forgot to check on it.  By time it finally arrived which was another fifteen minutes later I had eaten half of my wife&#39;s salad which was actually good.  Hence the second star.  The waiter then took another 30 minutes before I was able to tell him we were waiting for the check.  It was no wonder the line was out the door, because we took a table for two hours.  Both times the managers came by they apologized but offered no desert or anything.  I went ahead and paid full price for horrible service but my tip showed the waiter how I felt about his service at only 11% (I usually tip 20-25%).

Horrible service. I came with my family for lunch on my grandma&#39;s birthday and we were told there would be a wait of 30 minutes. The one tiny bench available for you to sit while waiting was full of people so after an hour and 15 minutes pass by and my grandma is beyond tired of standing I ask the manager why we still have not been paged for a table, only to have him YELL to me and my family that we could have already been seated and ordering if we weren&#39;t wasting time complaining about it. I asked him why they didn&#39;t page us if there was already a table ready and available and again he tells us its because we would not shut up. He was super rude and not at all professional and the reason why I&#39;m giving this two starts instead of zero is because our waitress was very helpful and kind.

We were incredibly impressed by how kind the staff was at 11:30 at night. These poor people were tired and we could tell they had a looooonnnnngg night, but that didn&#39;t stop them from smiling, giving us excellent service, and great food. We sat in the bar, so our hat&#39;s off to the bartender and the unbelievably charming young lady that was helping him. I could kick myself for not getting her name!!! She won our hearts over!!  Thanks for being so kind and we appreciate the great service folks!!

Everything was going well until my boyfriend and i ordered water as our drinks. My water was half sprite and half water, i know this because it contained a minimal amount of bubbles and my boyfriend and i could clearly taste the sprite. The disgusting part was that I ORDERED WATER. Did my server just use an old glass of someone else&#39;s beverage that he presumed was water and refill it? Because i also noticed greasy finger smudges.... i hadn&#39;t had food yet so those weren&#39;t mine.  <br>When we informed the server, all he said was &#34;my bad&#34;. My next glass of water smelt like fish. Maybe i just became sensitive because i was traumatised by the sprite water.<br>Our food was good, my fish and chips were bland. Boyfriend enjoyed his pizza. If i ever come back, it&#39;ll be for the cheese cake.

Great Service at this location when I went! Water was consistently refilled, we were checked on multiple times, and the food was great! I mean----$6 appetizers? And they are like the size of entrees! It&#39;s unreal! <br><br>We had the buffalo blasts, avocado egg rolls, chicken sliders and potstickers! All of them were delicious and we had all our condiments there at the table without even asking! <br><br>I also had a margarita and it was pretty good! Not the best one I&#39;ve tried but would definitely have it again.<br><br>I love happy hours and this location and establishment is sure on my list!

If I just rate the cheesecake, this place would get a full 5 stars. Those things are so delicious they are deadly. However, I rated them average (3 stars) because well, the service was average. Our waitress disappeared and for awhile we were left alone. No refills, no condiments. We had to ask a different waiter walking by for help! Now I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory in the past, and the service we get is usually really good, but for some reason this place failed at executing. Possibly an off day? I don&#39;t know, but luckily we can get the cheesecakes to go ;)

This was a complete sad trip to Cheesecake Factory. I love Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s sister restaurant GranLuxe. However, this has been a beyond disappointing evening. It took almost 2 hours for a table of 7 to get through dinner. Drinks took 20 mins. Food almost 45 mins. Desserts an additional 25 mins. When main course was brought out, there was part missing for my friends food. The delivery person responded &#34;I only have 2 hands&#34;. Hmm everyone at our table has 2 hands as well but as a patron, of the order is missing something why would we not mention it. We ordered and are paying for the food. We should get what we ordered. The service was extremely slow and our server skipped our table multiple times. The manager stopped by for a quick moment but was no help. Another meal did not taste correct. It took 10 mins to get the server over. The manager offered to take the meal off the bill, which I would think is standard. But then 15 mins went by before the server came back to get her new order. It was a sad evening. I won&#39;t be back to this location. I&#39;ll stick to Sugarland location instead.

Parking was much better then GALLERIA of course. We came for Happy Hour and was seated right away. The server was a little slow but she was nice. The water taste weird so I stuck with the JW Lemonade. The food came from it pretty fast.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a win for me! They have A TON of menu options, a light menu (Thank goodness), amazing cheesecake, and overall good food! This particular location is always packed! If you&#39;re okay with sitting at the bar or a high top table, DO IT!! It&#39;s full service, and you won&#39;t have to wait 20+ minutes just to sit at a regular table.<br>General Cheesecake Factory Tips:<br>1. When they bring out the bread, make sure you get the brown bread... delicious!<br>2. Come ready to eat! The portions are HUGE, so either come ready to eat, or be prepared to get a to-go box!<br>3. The amount of food options is OVERWHELMING. Some might find this to be a negative, I don&#39;t particularly care.. it is what it is. <br>4. If you&#39;re watching your figure... don&#39;t even bother ordering from the regular menu. Go straight to Skinnylicious.<br>5. Try the cheesecake at least once! Cheesecake is in their title! You have to try at least once! I didn&#39;t think I liked cheesecake, but this place proved me wrong!<br><br>My last visit, we specifically went just for cheesecake, and sat at the hightop instead of waiting for a table. Thanks to that, we had no wait, we were quickly served, and enjoyed our cheesecake!<br>I ordered the Salted Caramel, and my boyfriend ordered the Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT THE SALTED CARAMEL CHEESECAKE! By far the best cheesecake I&#39;ve had there. The blondie brownie on the bottom was what convinced me, but overall this is just WONDERFUL!!! Definitely a must try for anyone who likes Salted Caramel!

Love this place for happy hour. Lots of food options for $6 or less and great drink specials. The bartenders at this location are very attentive. Get the Buffalo Blasts, Tex Mex eggrolls and Factory Nachos and you will be a happy camper.

This Cheesecake Factory is located in Memorial City mall which is huge and has an ice skating rink inside. I ordered a California cheesesteak and it wasn&#39;t anything to write home about. It was mostly chewy and fatty. I couldn&#39;t finish it. I would never order it again. Our drinks were constantly refilled but barely ever any ice in them. I&#39;m docking two stars due to the no ice and the crappiness of my meal. Oh well! It happens! We would certainly come back.

Been to Cheesecake Factory so many times... I usually always get the bang bang chicken and shrimp which is always good. I tried the mac and cheese burger definitely a miss... its not what you would expect. It sounds great but when you actually get it it&#39;s a disappointment. Cheesecakes are always great I had the pecan turtle cheesecake. You can&#39;t go wrong with desserts here. The avocado egg rolls are really good. My husband loves their lettuce wraps.

We have dined at this location of the Cheesecake Factory on multiple occasions. Even though the location is busy, we typically receive good service with the consistent good food. This must have been an off night, because our service was an absolute embarrassment. We waited 30 mins after receiving drinks before ordering our appetizer and entrees. Even after ordering our food, service did not improve as our server Melissa ignored our table and would disappear for long periods of time. The only reason that we received our food in a timely manner was due to other servers.

Where do I start? The service at CCF has gone downhill  rapidly. <br>Parking was great today.<br>We were greeted immediately and seated pretty quickly. However once we were seated it took the waiter 10 mins to acknowledge us  (almost making us miss happy hour) and he started serving the guest who were seated AFTER us?!?!?! <br>Food: We were notified our appetizer (chicken sliders) were made wrong so they were sent back and took forever to come out. When they did come back out they were missing condiments so I had to flag down our waiter....by the time the condiments came the sliders were cold.<br>My husband&#39;s pasta was missing in action and the waiter had to check on this. By now everyone else was finished with their meal and ready to go. <br>I understand being short staffed but this is unacceptable CCF.<br><br>I contacted CCF and still no follow up. We will not be returning

Came here last night with a group of friends! Our waitress, Christie M., was awesome! She was very knowledgeable, patient, and friendly! We ordered stuffed mushrooms and fried mac and cheese for appetizers. <br><br>So. Good. <br><br>I ordered the Herb Crusted Salmon. It was cooked to perfection! It wasn&#39;t over cooked and the fillet flaked off perfectly. The lemon dill sauce was creamy and paired well with the asparagus and mash potatoes. <br><br>Overall, I think Cheesecake is a great chain... especially when you are craving all kinds of comfort food. All of our plates came out hot and was as expected. To note, their portions are huge (you can probably share one entree among two people). They have plenty of options to choose from on the menu (plenty is an understatement!).

THEIR TO-GO IS TRASH!!! The only reason why I&#39;m giving 2 stars is because the food is good...but I can&#39;t ever order anything cause the minute they put me on hold I have to wait for 10-20 minutes and probably even longer if I decide to just not hang up. And if I do get through...I still have to wait 15 minutes for my food to come out. It&#39;s sad that when I go to pick it up, I call before I even pull in so that I don&#39;t have to wait as long. This isn&#39;t the only located with poor to-go orders. You guys need to get it together because your food is decent and so is everything else so it needs to be up to par. Ridiculous.

We came here to celebrate our son&#39;s 20th birthday. This is our second visit and both the food and the service is amazing. Love this place. Get here early or you will be waiting a long time for a table.

I&#39;ve visited this location many times. Today service was awful. I waited 20 minutes before anyone realized I wasn&#39;t  part of the decor and I actually wanted a meal. No fuss, because I was waiting on my husband to join me. We ordered drinks...mine came out on time and his took another 30 minutes to arrive. We stayed seated for an hour and 15 minutes and probably spent 25 minutes actually eating. Great food....poor service.

This place is a joke. How do you make people wait for over an hour for food to be delivered to the table. The drinks were brought one at a time for a party of four. There was a couple next to us that were sat maybe 30 mins after us and yet got their food waaaaaaaay before we did. Waitress would disappear for a long time before checking up on us. Oh yea... And this place is hot like the devil&#39;s armpit!!! You would be better of to go the California pizza kitchen next door. Pathetic!!!

It might be a pretty empty lunch weekend lunch gathering, or the lack of emotions in the air. And it&#39;s certainly not the food that would attract a gathering.<br><br>Normally I like the Cheescake factory, tons of appetizer to fight over, and a slice of heaven as the reprise. Yet the meal at this location is just not up to the standard. <br><br>The greasy, batter encroached shrimp had the texture of a year old corndog. Then it was paired with a fish that needed all the gravy absorbed to force down. Only item that was not too bad is the steamed asparagus. <br><br>This is a for sure no revisit.

I need to start off by saying that CF has always been my solid go-to restaurant. Hungry but not sure what I want? CF&#39;s huge menu would satisfy any craving from super sweet to savory. In general, all their franchises serve pretty good food - not great but pretty consistent. <br><br>Here was the problem with tonight&#39;s visit. Went with a friend, had grilled artichokes, avocado salad, miso salmon, decaf coffee and 30th anniversary chocolate cheesecake.  All the food was OK. We were not offered bread but then again, I could have just asked for it. Then came the bill....<br><br>I couldn&#39;t help but notice a glaring tipping guide highlighted in bright orange. For me, this was very odd. Out of everything, my server felt the need to highlight the tipping guide. I don&#39;t know why she felt the need to do this so I kindly asked for a manager. I asked the manager if it was customary for waiters to highlight the bills. She said yes. I asked which particular parts are typically highlighted. She said the tipping guide! Then she went on to explain to me that since Obama got rid of the mandatory service charges of parties over 6, they started to highlight the tipping guide. I didn&#39;t quite understand the reasoning or explanation but verified that all the servers typically highlight it for everyone regardless of party size. There is no way to see if she&#39;s telling the truth but I&#39;d like to know if other yelpers have seen this before. Perhaps I&#39;m just making a big deal over nothing?<br><br>Here&#39;s what really gets me. My server highlighted the tipping guide on all 3 copies of my bill. It didn&#39;t sit well with me and left a very bad taste in my mouth. There are not many times where I feel openly discriminated, but in this case, I felt like I was given a tipping lesson and for what reason?<br><br>I thanked the manager for verifying that this is the restaurant&#39;s normal practice. The waiter came back and very abruptly said &#34;I&#39;m sorry if I offended you&#34;. I said &#34;no, you shouldn&#39;t be sorry. Your manager just confirmed that your restaurant does this with all the tables. I just don&#39;t really understand why&#34;. She said that it saves the customer time from having to pull out their phone and calculate the tip. I told her even if she didn&#39;t highlight it, it is very obvious on the bill. <br><br>All in all, if everyone is treated like this, I think CF should rethink their policies. It&#39;s just not professional and really lacks class. I know it&#39;s not a 5 star restaurant but does it need to be this way?

I was under the impression I had already reviewed this place but I guess not. It was a great idea to place a Cheesecake Factory at this location. It&#39;s a very attractive spot in Memorial City. On my first visit of this location, I was impressed with them having a separate waiting area where you can order  appetizers while waiting on your table. I think that was a great addition to the restaurant. In addition to the location, I also love how the restaurant looks on the inside. It makes you feel like you&#39;re actually going to a nice place without having to drive downtown or across town. The service was decent. I would like to suggest that the waiter needs to confirm rules and menu before saying YES. <br>Strike #1- I ordered the Cajun Chicken and Shrimp jambalaya. I asked if it came with garlic bread. He said yes. Then he came back and told me no....he offered another type of bread but I wasn&#39;t interested.<br>Strike #2- I told him it was my wife&#39;s bday and I asked if they do anything special like a song or dance for Bdays. He replied, I will see what we can which caused me to assume there will be some form of acknowledgement. Well NOTHING was mentioned after that. <br>I am just not one to force good service in an environment where my food preparation is involved.  Outside of that everything else was great, including the extensive menu.  I wish I was adventurous enough to try everything on the menu...GO shop around at the mall and hit up the Cheesecake Factory for a great meal!

Busy, busy Saturday night. We waited for a table in less time than they said, about 15 minutes, not bad. Beautiful place! A little too dark for me, but very nice.<br>We had crab dip appetizer  &amp; it was fabulous! Caesar salad was fresh &amp; great, but way to big. The small was too big in a 14&#34; bowl full! Baked potato soup was <br>great! I had a small Greek salad that was loaded with veggies &amp; olives &amp; feta cheese &amp; was great. . Pretzel chicken bites were so good. My friend ordered a B&amp;B, they put ice in it??She sent it back. All the food was very fresh &amp; great.<br>The menu is way to big, like a book &amp; takes too long to read. The service was a bit slow. We were there over 2 1/2 hours. But we realized how busy they were.<br>We ordered 4 slices of cheesecake to go. Chocolate, Peanut butter, Deluche &amp; chocolate chip. All the cheesecake we enjoyed. We will return.

Great service, great taste, amazing portions. My daughter ordered a pasta and she didn&#39;t even finish half of it. Although, the place is way to dark my wife almost tripped. The cheesecake was huge and delicious. We are definitely coming back

Awful experience! <br>I love Cheesecake Factory but every time I go to this location there is a situation. Most of the time the waiters and waitresses are unprofessional. You have to ask them over and over again to get what you need. They disappear for a long time so you never get refills or bread. And if it&#39;s not the serving, it is the food. It&#39;s either the pasta are not cooked enough, or plate served cold. Or they don&#39;t have the products on the menu, such as, Salmon. Every time I give it the benefit of the doubt and I tell myself it was probably bad luck or a bad day for this location but I think that is just how they do business. I went back 3 times and every time another bad experience! No going to this location ever again!
Ate there Thursday night.  Service was slow, food was ok but not their best day. Everything was pretty indifferent, service was the worst. 10 minutes before anyone came around to check on us.

Dianei D is a prestigious example of what restaurant bar/wait staff should be. From the introduction, to food/drink choices. She meet my fiancé and I with a happy smile and positive attitude. I could definitely go on and explain the great things, but I&#39;ll leave it to everyone to go in and request her and experience it yourself. She accommodated our needs to a perfection. To top it off she made my fiancé&#39; birthday amazing.  Please if management reads and follows this. She needs to be recognized for her outstanding service.

Always packed so prepare yourself! They offer valet for a fee and depending on when you go its probably your best bet cause the malls parking lot is over crowded always. I&#39;ve had some good food and bad food from here but what keeps me coming back is the cheesecake!! Love their cheesecake. I like the red velvet but the Oreo is by far my favorite.

The food is ALWAYS great but it&#39;s hit or miss with the service. I feel like they know they are going to be tipped good at the end of the day due to the fact that people go there because of the name &#34;The Cheesecake Factory.&#34; Lucky for them where they work. The service sometimes just SUCKS. The food does come out quick but the waitress we had never really said a word to us. It was always a different person that picked up our plates when we were done. The food is just soooo good though. They have SOOOOO many option on the menu and desserts.
They do not take reservations, and cannot handle large parties. DO NOT try and have get togethers here, only feasible for small groups/families. Food is great, but experience was lacking.

The service was great. The waiters and waitresses are always on point with their customer service skills, they take note and pay attention to their tables. When our water/teas were low, they topped them off. When the bread started to disappear, they refilled the basket. <br><br>Ordered the santa fe chicken salad, simply because I really like the cilantro dressing it comes with. Also had the avocado eggrolls and calamari. The portions are big, but you can also ask for a lunch portion if you want. <br><br>For dessert, had the traditional strawberry cheesecake...mmmmm. You cant leave cheesecake factory without a cheesecake. Simply delicious..
Should have known what to expect from the last 2 times we were here..they don&#39;t deserve their stars..

I usually just run into this place to get a slice and back out and that takes forever. Today we went for my niece&#39;s bday celebration and it was terrible. Once we got seated, we waited at least 15 mins before I finally had to get up and ask a waitress if she could find out who our server was,she said she would get our drink orders and then find our server. We got our drinks from her and they forgot my husband&#39;s tea. I then after waiting another 20 minutes had to get up to ask for bread. Then after bread came it was another 10 minutes before we gave our food order. When the food came, my salad was wrong, my brother&#39;s gf order was totally wrong and when they put it down in front of her they said the right thing but it was a completely different plate. It was over an hour and a half before we got our food. Of course the only time they were on point, is when it was time to pay and our pymt was taken by a mgr. our waitress tried her best but she was working 2 different sections at the same time. I won&#39;t be returning.

The food is a hit or miss but the service is always terrible. I like to come here because of the extensive menu. Over the course of time I&#39;ve been here, I&#39;ve had the steak Diane, pasta da Vinci, dynamite shrimp, southern fried chicken sliders, stuffed mushrooms, honey truffle chicken, meatloaf, pasta carbonara, fried calamari pasta with shrimp and sausage, farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic, bistro shrimp pasta, spinach cheese dip, nachos, miso salmon, mac and cheese burger, fried mac and cheese and the cheesecake were all ok, however having the name &#34;Cheesecake Factory, the cheese cake didn&#39;t wow me much. It was actually not good. I remember last time it being so good but this time it wasn&#39;t (oreo cheesecake). I also love the bread they bring you out first before your food(brown bread) yum! Food is decent price, not too expensive, but the service is horrible which gears me towards the no side of coming back. I&#39;ve had to ask for silverware MULTIPLE times, ordered a couple steaks and no steak knives, no refill, didn&#39;t clean table up, had a table of 10 people and brought out only 6 loafs of bread. Really I&#39;m just over it. Not to mention I came at 2pm and waited until 3 for a table and didn&#39;t get my food until 4:30 and spent overall 3 hrs here and it wasn&#39;t that packed. Yeah it was busy but it wasn&#39;t crazy so there&#39;s no excuse for a slow turtle waiter that seems to be hung over

If there was an option I would give you no stars. My experience was horrible for my first time visiting. We started off being seated in a closed section and the waitress told us her feet were hurting and she was leaving for the day. After that the experience was downhill. Please do no visit this location. To top It off I filled out a form online and still haven&#39;t been contacted.

The waitress recommended the Carne Asada steak. It was okay. The steak was not as tender as I like. I ordered it medium well. I also ordered a Pineapple mojito which was just okay. The reason for the three stars is strictly for the status of the restroom. The restroom was extremely dirty and reeked of urine. There were no paper towels to dry hands. The stall was dirty as well. I probably will not return. I think Cheesecake Factory in general is overrated.

Poor customer service. I ordered some cheesecake to go last night, like I have done before. This time the cheesecake was watery and foamy. I talked to the manager about it the following day and he refused to do anything about it since I no longer had a paper copy of my receipt. I showed him my debit card transaction for Cheesecake Factory with amount and dated time stamp. He still refused. Totally unaccountable and dismissive of customers.
Their pasta da Vinci is always perfect. Food and service from the waiters are always on point. Don&#39;t forget to try the White chocolate raspberry truffle.

Service was good, but the food was terrible.  Both of our chicken dishes tasted fishy.  My chicken and biscuits plate was a mess, with grease instead of gravy and burnt, dry biscuits.  I usually love that dish.  It was clear both dishes sat under a heat lamp, the plates were hot but the food was luke warm with a thick film on the sauces.<br><br>Terrible quality on the food, bad taste, and disgusting appearance (greasy with a thick film).<br><br>Never going back to this location.

I am surprised to see a 3/5 star rating for this place. Since I would recommend it to all my friends. Here is why:<br><br>Perk #1: You have a group of friends debating what to eat. Well debate no more, their menu caters to everyone&#39;s taste. They have an extensive menu filled with good tasting food. Nothing magnificent but by no means bad.<br><br>Perk #2: People say you &#34;can&#39;t have your cake and eat it too&#34;. At this place you can, because you will find yourself wanting to order more than one cheesecake. So eat your cheesecake because you will probably end up ordering seconds to take home. My favorites so far are their red velvet cake, Chris&#39; outrageous, and snickers cheesecake. OMG! you will not be disappointed I guarantee it with a 5 year warranty. <br><br>Perk #3: Their bread and butter! I love their brown bread! If it is your first time here be careful or you might end up filling up just eating it. That good? YES!<br><br>Perk #4: good place for couples as it has a romantic feel to the place. But how romantic on a scale of 1-5? Solid 3. <br><br>Perk #5: Memorial City Mall is right next door to walk the food off. Believe me their portions are not small unless you are ordering from their skinny menu.

I have been here many times and i am almost always impressed. I feel like they give you large portions, so its worth the cost. My favorites entrees are the stuffed chicken tortillas, chicken Marsala, and chicken and biscuts. I recently went and got an omelette which was high and delicious.

Horrible service! My food was brought to me wrong twice in a row. The waitress tried to bring me my meal a third time and of course I declined and just asked that it be taken off my check at that point. No manager came over to apologize or anything. Never will I patronize this particular location again. The ladies at the bar were amazing and they deserve recognition!

Went out for date night . What happen to this place. Even the manager doesn&#39;t care . Everyone around got food and desert and then my food appears.  Wtf .  My food was wrong and over done said they would make a new one....brought back out my same dish..really!!!! My wife&#39;s plate was so hot she burned her hand! Manager is Julie Greer did offer anything for all the problems...close the door!!!!!!!

Came here for Brunch, ordered the breakfast Monte Cristo sandwich and sweat tea. Debra was our waitress, and I was glad that she was Excellent service and great attitude. She kept the drinks filled and checked by often.<br><br>The monte Cristo can easily serve 2 adults, it&#39;s huge ( as is most of the portions here ). The flavor was just sinful, I know I gained 5 pounds during this meal, and I really should watch what I eat, but wow that was awesome. The rest of the comments from my crew varied from very good to great ( French toast garnered that sentiment from my daughter ).<br><br>Hey I get that it&#39;s a chain, but they&#39;ve got great food. On this visit the service was great, the waits can be tough, but in most of H town and the surrounding areas, good places have waits . Though on this visit the wait was less than 2 minutes.<br><br>I look forward to my next visit, but I need to lose a few pounds first.

Kari was very personable. The food was amazing. I had the boom boom chicken and shrimp. So much food and the flavors were incredible! Daughter had the blackened shrimp scampi, lots of food and flavor. Hubby had a steak and mashed potatoes that he was very pleased with. I had a blood orange martini that was good but too sweet for my personal preference. We sat outside and had a lovely time!

I despise dishonest people with a passion. And sorry Cheesecake Factory, but ya&#39;ll be hiring some dishonest people. It pains me to write this review because this was my first visit in a very long time. Maybe it&#39;s because I&#39;m not a big fan of 2000 calorie dishes. But anyway back to why I am writing this review. <br><br>I knew that one of these days, saving my receipts would pay off and today it has. After checking my CC statement, I realized that my server went ahead and inserted a larger tip than what I initially left him. Don&#39;t get me wrong, the service was great in the beginning but really lacked at the end of the meal. Maybe it&#39;s cause we didn&#39;t order dessert and ordered water?? Again, think about the calories sheesh!!! Nonetheless, I left him a 20% tip. Reasonable right? Well apparently that amount was not good enough for him, so he took the liberty of adding a couple of more dollars. Yes it&#39;s only a few more dollars but wtf this is so wrong of you! If I wanted to tip you 25-30% I would!! I don&#39;t recall this ever happening to me, not even when I am piss drunk at a bar. Can you believe that? <br><br>When it comes down to it at the end of the day, it&#39;s not about the money, IT&#39;S ABOUT THE PRINCIPLE.

I didn&#39;t listen to my conscience.  It told me not to do it.  &#34;Don&#39;t eat there.  Just walk away.&#34;  I didn&#39;t listen.  I wish I had.  <br><br>Service was okay - it wasn&#39;t a train wreck, but it wasn&#39;t stellar.  <br><br>Food?  Horrible.  Nothing was good.  My not-very-picky 4-year-old wouldn&#39;t even eat much of what we offered him off of our plates.  I had (only two bites of) the angel hair pasta with grilled shrimp.  My wife ordered something that was equally unappealing.  <br><br>On the positive side, this would be a great place to go if you&#39;re on a diet.  You get grossed out by the &#34;food&#34; they bring you and you lose your appetite!
Miso Salmon with a salad substitute instead of rice!!! With an Oreo cheesecake that taste just like heaven!  parking on Sunday&#39;s is usually hard to find though.
The service was good they just took forever to get the food to us, and even longer to get the check.

This was my first time having anything other than drinks and apps. I immediately regretted it. The waitress was AWESOME. Drinks too. But the chicken Alfredo was OVERCOOKED, tremendously. And it even made me sick.
The lemon Ricotta pancakes are to die for. You can definitely taste the lemon but not too over powering., they are light &amp; fluffy.

The wait was about 45 minutes, as expected especially when cheesecake was half off!<br>Im not sure what our servers name was while ordering/eating, she didn&#39;t introduce herself. Staff is very busy so they aren&#39;t as attentive, so you&#39;re trying to get their attention more than they try to pay yours. <br><br>We ordered the buffalo blast and two cheesecake, mango and white chocolate w/ caramel. Our accompanying friends ordered a buffalo blast as well along with a steak and fried macaroni app.<br><br>Our food came out first (even the cheese cake). Buffalo blast was yummy, this is an app BUT they&#39;re so big it can be an entree for two. Spicy and yummy (chicken mixed with buffalo sauce with a fried wrap around it served with buffalo sauce and blue cheese).<br><br>Fried Mac was never brought out, and once our friends medium well steak came it was the beginning to an end. Steak was BLOODY red, very rare, we made our server aware and she got a new one but my friend got it to go due to loss of appetite (that happens when you wait so long for food and when you get it it&#39;s not what you expect). So he also ordered two cheesecakes to go. Everything was brought out BUT the steak and the server almost let us go home without it had we not double checked. <br><br>I could see following tables were having trouble reaching their servers as well, maybe introducing themselves to their guest would be easier rather than guest having to wait on their servers. I figured out our servers name from the ticket and from there I could address her.<br><br>Would be 5 stars for food but 3 is for service.<br><br>Cheesecake was delicious!
Worst service ever!!!! They lost my order and never came to check on our table never got our drinks refilled.  NEver coming back!!!!!!

As a person who never leaves reviews, (which I probably should more often as I dine in so many amazing restaurants around houston) I was disappointed enough to spend the time to write this one. I am very familiar with quality food and service as I work in one of Houston&#39;s top 5 restaurants and love the restaurant industry. Here, the food was disappointing and the service was even worse.<br><br>My girlfriend made our 6-top reservation for her bestfriend&#39;s birthday. I was excited to eat here as I hadn&#39;t been in years. Our service wasn&#39;t bad too start as our server got to us in a timely fashion and took drink orders. We then moved on to ordering food. I let my server know that I have an onion allergy and would like my burger WITHOUT onions. Our dishes came out, and the first thing I notice in my open burger were onions coming off the side. The server just dropped the plates and ran off. I was able to wave him down after about 3 minutes and tell him. He then took my plate and brought me a new one (which I believe they just pulled the onions off of the same burger) but it&#39;s okay. 3 out of the 6 of us ordered burgers with sides of French fries. All 3 of our orders of fries were not only stale, but as you got to the center of them, were literally frozen cold. I&#39;m guessing they use frozen fries which is not a huge problem, but at the very least cook them all the way through. We weren&#39;t able to tell our server immediately because he wasn&#39;t back for another 15-20 minutes. Once he finally made it back, we told him about the frozen fries. He proceeded to ask if we wanted a replacement or just a different side. Our plates were completely finished (other than the fries that had barely been touched), why would we just want to finally get a fresh side? We told him it was too late as we had already finished our plates. He just started taking our plates to throw away the remainder. <br><br>It only gets worse from here....<br>Before he walks off with the plates, we then told him it was (my girlfriend&#39;s bestfriend&#39;s) birthday. He says &#34;oh cool&#34; and continues clearing plates. He looks at her and asks &#34;do you want a cheesecake or some type of dessert?&#34; She says yes that&#39;d be great. He brings her a cheesecake with a candle and sings happy birthday blah blah blah. Immediately after singing, he asks us who&#39;s tab is he charging the cheesecake to. Confused, my girlfriend looks up and says just to just add it to ours. <br><br>Now I know separate checks can be confusing, but we told him from the beginning to separate the tabs by table (it was the three couples). After some waiting, he finally brings the checks which are literally messed up in every aspect possible. I then asked for a manager to come get it situated and to let them know about everything that had happened during the meal. The manager even took about 20 minutes to come. During that time, the server came back and took the checks to fix them. I know managers can get busy, so not a huge deal. At this time, we&#39;re waiting for our fixed checks to come back. I tell the manager about our ENTIRE experience and she says &#34;Next time you just need to get us involved earlier so we can make sure after the first mess up that you&#39;re being taken care of.&#34; <br><br>I wasn&#39;t aware that if I go out to eat at The Cheesecake Factory, I have to request to be taken care of by a manager just to get a decent meal with decent service. If the staff was trained properly at this establishment, maybe this wouldn&#39;t be necessary. Even then, the manager didn&#39;t even apologize for our experience. She just turned it around and said that WE needed to get them involved earlier. How pathetic. There will not be a next time. I will never dine at this establishment again. Possibly the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at one dinner.

Ordered some white chicken chili which I get ALL the time from the galleria location and typically LOVE. Ordered today via door dash from this location and I&#39;m EXTREMELY disappointed. The beans are severely undercooked and hard. If I hadn&#39;t had it delivered I would go over and complain in person. Huge let down.
The Hibachi steak tastes amazing and the cheesecake..... too good for words. Amazing place for a romantic date night, or just a casual brunch. Located at a great place too!!

I give this place 4 stars mainly because of the service. My steak was over cook BUT our server was really nice and attentive. My friend sent her salad back as well. Only because she didn&#39;t like the salad dressing they put on it ( she asked for ranch, and the server even noted it as well.) My over all experience was pretty good.

Me and a big group of my family came here this last weekend, and my mom had tried to call ahead to try and make a reservation for 20 since we were going to be  surprising my grandma for her birthday, when she was told they don&#39;t take reservations. Already a little odd to me, but okay, I guess. Anyway, the whole party was there at 1, and we didn&#39;t get seating until about 1:45, but to be fair it was Sunday right around lunch time. When we were seated, we were given the outside seating, and had the tables pretty much set up as if many different parties were going to be using the area, not just our family, so we waited and stood around looking confused for a while until we decide to start moving tables together ourselves, when the person who turned out to be our waiter eventually came out to help. The waiter was overall nice, but nothing stellar as far as service, and getting any drink orders took forever, and the food took even longer. As far as taste, I enjoyed my plate as did most everyone else, but the wait for everything just took so long. I know it&#39;s a large group, but I figured with a birthday being hosted there, we would have had more attentive service and it would have been faster in general.

Ok, I would like to start off by saying that we have given this location several chances and we are disappointed each and every time. Our family of four were pleased to be seated quickly and upon arrival on a Wednesday evening but then it all went downhill from there. Our server was pleasant but also forgetful. She messed up when placing our order and forgot one of our drinks too. The person who brought our drinks to the table had a very strong odor of cigarette smoke and his hands and fingernails were quite dirty. The complimentary is bread is something we look forward too but this time the bread was very hard and not palatable. The food seemed rushed out and we were not satisfied with our meals either. I ordered the Jamaican black pepper shrimp with white rice and plantain. The shrimp was under cooked which is hard to do with shrimp. My husband and daughter were also dissatisfied with their burgers. The fried cheese mozzarella was intolerable as well. Overall, we were not pleased with the service nor the food, so much so that I decided to leave an honest review of my family&#39;s experience.

Not very good or expeditious service. Silverware wasn&#39;t at table and had to request some after waiting for some period of time. When silverware arrived many utensils were dirty and we had to ask for replacements.  <br><br>Asked for a waitress change and service improved significantly.  Tipped our new waitress our standard 20% for her excellent service.

My only regret was that I had no room for Cheesecake ! LOL. I sat in the bar alone &amp; got excellent service. I went during the Christmas shopping season, so parking was a nightmare. I was glad to finally get to my seat for some refreshing Strawberry Lemonade, that stuff is so bad for me, but I look forward to the occasional treat. Then they brought out that crack that is otherwise known as the bread basket. I don&#39;t know what they put on that brown loaf with oats on top, but it is highly addictive !! I ordered  a salad for my Entrée &amp; the server suggested the Crab Bites for my appetizer &amp; that was a really good choice. They were full of flavor &amp; I would definitely order them again. My salad was fresh &amp; the lunch portion was still a very good size portion.

Our server was awesome and her name is Nikita. <br><br>The calamari used to be good but is was soggy, the batter is falling off. --because of this i&#39;ll give it a three <br><br>However, The bacon bacon burger is the bomb diggity!!!!!

It&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory! What could go wrong? If I were one of those people who could eat whatever they wanted and never gain weight, I would eat at The Cheesecake Factory at least once a week. Their food is loaded with fat, cheese, and sugar and it&#39;s DELICIOUS!<br><br>Alas, I am not one of those aforementioned naturally skinny people, so the Skinny Menu allows me to feel somewhat better about myself before I devour a massive, gluttonous, whipped cream covered piece of cheesecake. <br><br>Seriously though, the Skinny Menu has lots of delicious options and seems like a good balance when you know you&#39;re going to indulge in dessert. <br><br>Or every once in a while, just give in and have a decadent entree AND dessert (you can for sure have leftovers of both - portions are HUGE). <br><br>The complimentary brown bread is also worth the calories (skip the white bread). <br><br>And for the massive portions, I feel as though the prices are right. And the staff are always so nice.<br><br>Parking here can be a PAIN, but that&#39;s because it&#39;s part of the mall.<br><br>Mmmmmmmm, I love The Cheesecake Factory.

On Sunday evening I went to this location to purchase a few slices of cheesecake, I was so displeased with the entry way, the sidewalk was very dirty and in need of power washing. I started to leave because as the saying goes &#34;First Impressions Are Lasting Impressions&#34;, unfortunately for me, while waiting for my order, I noticed how dirty the doors were, the hostess, 3 to be exact were just standing around talking, there was trash on the floor a straw near the cheesecake display &amp;&#39;a piece of paper that was stuck to the floor with everyone walking past it, including the Manager on duty, Greg, who was very nonchalant when I spoke with him to make him aware of my observation, he just said ok and left it at that. I&#39;m sure when I left things remained just as they were while I was there. You never get a second chance to make a first impression, not impressed at all!!

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory ever!!!<br>Tip # 1 ask if the have any ground turkey because they don&#39;t tell until you order a skinny turkey burger. <br>Tip # 2 ask for complimentary sourdough bread because waitress doesn&#39;t  just bring it to you.<br>Tip # 3 make sure you bring your own toilet paper<br>Becau every stall in women&#39;s bathroom was out.<br>Tip # 4 Its worth the drive to the one in Sugar Land.

I&#39;ve been here a lot of times and the food is delicious, but I have to agree with some other customers, the service is no good, sometimes the staff treats you like you are bothering them just for being in there! That includes someone who I think is the manager, a blonde guy (not sure). But overall the cheesecakes are amazing, if they improve the staff I might give the restaurant a 5 star next time I go! <br><br>Today I visited The Cheesecake Factory at Memorial City Mall and the experience was AWFUL at first I seat outside and the heater was so high I felt I was in hell, sad because the weather was amazing... I gently asked the staff if they could turn it down a little bit but the answer was NO! Then they send me inside and had to wait again for a new table. Once we were seated the staff didn&#39;t even asked me if I wanted water for about 15-20 minutes, I had to ask the waitress if she could please take my order. When the food came they didn&#39;t bring my sides and my daughters so we had to wait another 10-15 minutes. Finally when I asked for the check, they charged me for my daughters side (which was usually included on the meal) but apparently now they don&#39;t include it and the waitress didn&#39;t even warn me about it.... at the end, at least they removed the side charge. If I could just review the waitress NICOLE I&#39;ll give her -1 stars but since it&#39;s the first time this happens I&#39;ll just reduce my rating of the restaurant to 3 stars!!! So sad this happened and no one even apologize for it, very bad customer service !!!!

I absolutely love everything about this cheesecake except for 2 things. <br>1. The lighting. I understand the whole romantic deal but it&#39;s absolutely too dark to even see your food let alone have a kids in there. <br>2. The floors are always slippery. I have to take baby steps just so I don&#39;t slip while walking. I ask the lady y it was slippery and she said that&#39;s how the whole place is. *not a great response. This is a lawsuit waiting to happen. <br><br>Other than the 2 things listed I love this place. Food is great. Cheesecake variety is awesome.

i did enjoy my meal at Cheesecake Factory but i will never return to this specific one, it was a party of 20 and the food took forever, now i understand it was a lot of people to take care of but I&#39;m talking 45 mins to a hour, we ignored it and continued our dinner but when it was time for the checks to come it took them 30 minutes to pass them out and when they did finally arrive to everyone they were all wrong we kindly told the waiters if we could talk to the manager and they told him we were being disrespectful which caused him to call security on us and threatening to arrest us because we were &#39;disturbing&#39; a family environment, he had even made the birthday girl cry therefore i will not be back to this one horrible business

I have tried the cheesecake factory in the galleria, up north and sugar land area but here at the memorial area is the worst. <br>Got here at 12p for lunch, we ordered our food at 1220ish and didn&#39;t get our food till after 1p. <br>I ordered the orange chicken - and the rice was dried and hard - the chicken was cold <br>The waiter said he was going to bring a manager and never came. <br>We will never come back.

Someone in management needs to commend Sandra.  That woman just served us when we weren&#39;t even in her section because we were sitting there being ignored.  Tipped her 50% for her extra effort. It&#39;s not the first time we&#39;ve had her and last time she was just as amazing. A gem for sure!

Overhyped. While we enjoyed ambiance of the place the food was not mind blowing. PF Changs has better lettuce wraps and the calamari was accurately reported by another reviewer as not crispy enough but more soggy. Crab bites were just that a tiny bite sized burnt round thing. For the price there are other better places.

Absolute worst service. Been there for 20 mins and no bread. Took the waitress more than 10 mins to come take out drink order. Asked for bread twice and 30 mins later she comes and we get up and leave. Worst experience ever.

Went here for dinner with my mom, since we had a gift card. To be honest, the only thing I really like about CF is the cheesecake, but their massive entree menu always gives me reason to believe that I&#39;ll find a diamond in the rough. <br><br>This time, I put my bet on the fish tacos, which I ordered fried. I envisioned a light, crunchy, and flavorful snack, but I should have known better. My enormous platter came loaded with four fish tacos, each tucked to the brim with a large and greasy battered fish nugget on a bed of mayo-saturated veggies. The taco shells consisted of two soft corn shells each, which I understand for the purpose structural integrity. However, all of this amounted to an overwhelming amount of subpar food for me. The tacos really could have used some crunchier veggies and maybe a tangy dipping sauce like salsa to brighten them up. Also, there was guac in the tacos, but so little that they might as well have left it out. The dish came with unexciting sides of black beans and dry, hard herbed rice. My mom ordered the Chicken Madeira, which really fared no better. We could only each finish half of our meal, and even at that point were close to exploding. <br><br>The cheesecake was the saving grace of the meal, as expected. I got an Oreo extreme dream cheesecake, and yes, it was as dense and uber rich as it sounds, but it was well worth it. Awesome choice if you love chocolate! And I&#39;m not afraid to admit that my favorite part is always the whipped cream. <br><br>The service was aight. The waiters were busy as usual, but tended to us in good time and were polite. <br><br>If you&#39;re looking to have dinner here, I suggest the glam burgers or something off the skinnylicious menu, as otherwise the food is not really worth the calories. Otherwise, just forgo the entree and cut straight to the real reason this place exists: the glorious cheesecake. <br><br>Tl;dr: Portions are huge, food is greasy, but cheesecake is solid.

I&#39;ve been to cheesecake many time for years. Today, my pregnant self, husband and along 3 kids and my sister waited literally over 30 mins to be seated. Fine, I get it. It happens sometime. But honestly today was one of my worst experience due to the hostess KATHERINE. Not only was she rude,super unfriendly and not once have I seen her smile at all to anyone that walked thru the door. I wish I had took a picture of her how unhappy she looks! She had that face like &#34;I hate my job and I hate people kinda face on&#34; <br>I requested to be seated outside since the patio is open. And her respond was very unprofessional... she says there wasn&#39;t any server outside but clearly there was two servers serving outside. I was disappointed because my family and I really wanted to sit outside and enjoy the day. She could have responded back in a friendly manners I would have understand. But what I don&#39;t understand is why is there people sitting outside if there is no server serving outside. At this point, I was hungry and tired of waiting and didn&#39;t want to make a big deal for not able to be seated outside. Looking back now I seriously wish I could had talk to a manager and point out about Katherine attitude and how unhappy and not so friendly customer services she is.<br>For further better services please approach with a better happy smile manners Katherine.

This Chain Restaurant was good 6 years ago. My experience at this location = poor customer service, tasteless, you will wait forever to get you order ready - and it will come &#34; cold &#34; . You can get much better food and service for this type of price if you go elsewhere.

I love Cheesecake Factory! The locations are few and hard to find. The only one I have been to is the one in memorial city. Everything is great about this restaurant, the ambience, the decor, the food.. Some of my faves here:<br>The brown bread(makes me love this place even more)<br>Firecracker Salmon<br>Fettuccini Alfredo <br>Herb Crusted Salmon (absolutely amazing)<br>Luau salad<br>And finally the Hershey&#39;s chocolate bar cheesecake...yummmm!<br><br>Need I say more? This place definately deserves a higher rating. DO give this place a try..

I try to stay away from this location for the following reasons: <br>- It&#39;s difficult to find parking because it&#39;s right beside Target at Memorial City Mall. Don&#39;t even think about going during the weekends. <br><br>- The service is terrible. Every time my family and I go, they sit us somewhere and forget about us. It usually takes 15 mins or more to get our drink order and then waiting for our entrees is a disaster. <br><br>I&#39;ve only had ONE experience where our server gave us excellent service. Other than that, they couldn&#39;t care less. <br><br>The food isn&#39;t reason enough for me to return either.
I love coming over here during the week because it&#39;s not as full but the food is good and the place is really nice as well, their cocktails and obviously the cheesecake are really good too.

I hadn&#39;t been to this location in a couple of years because every time I stopped by, there seemed to be a hundred people waiting for a table. But, I got a gift card for Christmas, so I decided to come here with my boyfriend for an early Saturday dinner. We arrived around 5pm and there were 19 parties ahead of us. Our wait was 30 minutes, which wasn&#39;t so bad since a party of 6 that came after us we did was told their wait would be two hours. Our server&#39;s name was Christie and she was very sweet, courteous, and made us feel right at home. But the food, on the other hand, didn&#39;t really impress me. I had the Skinnylicious Turkey Burger with a salad and some vinaigrette dressing. On a scale of 1-10, I&#39;d say about a 6. I had a spoonful of my boyfriend&#39;s Skinnylicious Chicken Pasta with Basil and it was okay. The sauce was pretty good and had a fresh basil taste.<br><br>The bill for the two of us was $25, but we didn&#39;t order drinks, just water, and we didn&#39;t get dessert either. I was told they do have reservations during the week, so I may be back again soon, when it&#39;s not as busy.<br><br>Another tip - be sure to listen CLOSELY if your name is called for a table (they were out of pagers when I arrived). I almost missed my table because I couldn&#39;t hear what the hostess was saying through all the clatter of plates and people talking around me. The hostess should definitely use a microphone to tackle this problem.<br><br>Great service from our server, food is all right.

I went to The Cheesecake Factory for a work lunch. Parking at The Cheesecake Factory is just like driving in Houston traffic anytime of the day: a hot mess. I came during the lunch hour. I had to park so far away from the restaurant that I actually worked off the lunch calories before I made it back to my car (or so it seemed.)<br><br>I ordered the Renee Special which is the chicken salad sandwich, soup and a house salad. I ordered water  to drink.<br><br>The clam chowder was creamy and delicious. It had an ample amount of clams, diced potatoes and onions in a rich, creamy broth. The chicken salad comes sliced in wedges of grilled, buttered toast, with some sort of sour, blue cheese type dressing. The chicken salad had a strange, almost sour flavor that overpowered my taste buds. It just didn&#39;t taste good. The house salad was well, just a salad. The greens and tomatoes were incredibly fresh, however. I didn&#39;t care for the bread that comes out first. The bread is served in an unlined, wire rack. When the bread comes, it&#39;s just the bread, the rack, and the table surface. LOL. The first batch of bread served was cold as ice. The bread was not that flavorful and too chewy. The  second batch of bread was warm but still not tasty enough of me to give it a great rating.<br><br>We had a great waitress. It took a while for the food to be served, maybe 20 minutes.<br><br>Overall, The Cheesecake Factory is overpriced for the quality of food that it serves. It was my first time coming there, and I was not impressed. Maybe I&#39;ll come back for the soup and the cheesecake, and just stay away from the main courses. I don&#39;t want to take any more chances paying that much money for entrées.

So i tried something different this time, I ordered off of the skinny menu (dont laugh at me) and got a pizza, which honestly it is small, but it was actually very delicious. It was the pear pizza.<br><br>Also I ordered the cheese stick appetizer, they come in about 6 or so pieces, they were yummy as well.<br><br>And I love the chocolate bread.
I enjoy it every time I go there. Very good service and of course I looove the food especially the salmon

We just enjoyed a Sunday breakfast at Memorial city cheesecake factory. It exceeded my expectations. The restaurant was comfortable and not too crowded and we were able to actually hear each other converse, which is always a bonus. The waitstaff was exceptional and the breakfast items we ordered were super tasty. Thank you to our waitress, V, for her charm and good service this morning. <br>I suspect this location is well-managed bc everyone seemed happy to work there and knew what they were doing.  I sure appreciate that too!!!<br>I think i found my new favorite Sunday breakfast place!

The experience was nothing less then great!<br><br>the valet was a great touch since we went in Xmas week and the parking was unbelievable I decided to park which took me 40 minutes to realize... Get the valet its only $10 trust me in a hectic weekend just cough it up lol. <br><br>It was definitely not family friendly or 5 and under children due to limited waiting area. we went on Xmas week and it was Cold and people had children waiting for a table with small children by the front door. Sad to see this kids freezing for a table with parents. Again not knocking the restaurant but if you know not just adults are coming to diner get a better place for kids too if that is where the franchise is heading to family. <br><br>It was very sophisticated location on the Memorial Mall, but not family friendly. If on a date, or meeting other adults it is a great place!!!!<br><br>The location seem to be to congested for my taste but that&#39;s just my little too cents. <br><br>The Staff, AWESOME! <br>We were helped with the menu since this was my first experience with the restaurant. The waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and when I asked for a recommendation he did a great job.   The meal was exquisite, and the price was ..well lets just say you get what you pay for and we got a lot lol.<br><br>At the end of the day I give this location a B+ if not just for what I saw with the kids waiting on the cold every single time someone opened the front doors. It was a great experience we will be going back soon.

We got here at 11:30, party of four. Still have not received our Nachos as an appetizer and it&#39;s now 12:15. We asked our waiter and he said the salad area is slammed right now. Clearly we are on our lunch break and we understand this is not the waiters fault, unless he forgot to put the order in-house we did see him walk back to the computer, so not sure if he forgot to add it to the order. Received no apology other than &#34;I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s taking so, long-can I go ahead and bring your lunch out?&#34; We cancelled the order for nachos after that. Received our &#34;lunch&#34; at 12:20. Spent 2 hours on lunch.

This was the first time we have eaten here. Will definitely be the last. After a 30 minute wait to be seated, 5 minutes before our lifeless waitress came, and 35 minutes before our food was served, we hoped for at least delicious food. Especially for the price. Unfortunately not. It was actually quite bad. However, the cheesecake was at least &#34;good.&#34; I mean, it wasn&#39;t like OMG!! considering they are a cheesecake &#34;factory&#34; and all. It was just...good. But so is the cheesecake you get for a much cheaper price elsewhere. Sorry. Fail.
It&#39;s pretty much what you&#39;d expect from a chain restaurant. Nothing fantastic, but my four starts are mainly for the amazing cheesecake varieties. So delicious!!!

Great experience at this location. All of the staff were super friendly. They played excellent music and brought out our food promptly and beautifully displayed. Refills were consistent and the food was hot. My only complaint about this location is that parking can be limited on weekends. But they offer valet for $10 to help during the times you don&#39;t want to trouble yourself with finding a spot. Oh, and try the Smore&#39;s Cheesecake. Super Good!

My husband and I went in for dinner last night and our server Terrance was phenomenal! All of his recommendations were spot on. We will definitely be back and asking for Terrance to be our server again!!

I had a work meeting in Houston (BLEH) and was staying at the Westin across the street.  I&#39;d never been to a Cheesecake Factory, and they love it on Big Bang Theory, so I figured what the heck!?  My SO was with me (I turned the trip into a vacation following the meeting) so we walked on over after deciding we didn&#39;t want to venture too far.<br><br>I had the Thai Lettuce Wraps to start.  THEY GIVE YOU SO MUCH!!!  And the plate is build-your-own.  So they just give you a ton of Satay Chicken Strips, Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Coconut Curry Noodles, and Lettuce Leaves with three Sauces - Peanut, Sweet Red Chili and Tamarind-Cashew.  It&#39;s soooo goood.  I love that I cold pick and choose what to put in my wraps.<br>I then had the Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane combination, which came with Mashed Potatoes.  It was just the right amount of each, and it tasted pretty darn good.  However, the steak was a little overdone for my liking.<br>For dessert, I had the Lemoncello Creme Torte - Layers of Vanilla Cake and Lemon Mascarpone Cream Topped with Streusel and Served with Strawberries and Whipped Cream.  I know, I didn&#39;t get cheesecake.  But this sounded delicious!  And it was.  I&#39;m a sucker for lemon and this sucked me right in.<br><br>For a chain restaurant, this Cheesecake Factory did not disappoint.

First time at the Cheesecake Factory the other day and my experience was alright... 2 drinks and 2 cheesecake for 30 bucks was hella expensive plus tips...cheesecake was good not gonna lie but it was alil to sweet. The down part was that the food there are hella expensive but they all sounded amazing got to go back one day to try it even though it&#39;s pricey...and I&#39;ll update my 2nd experience when I get the chance to go back...the service didn&#39;t impress me at all everything was slow for just 2 cheesecake and 2 drinks...overall my experience for a first time was alright... would I recommend it...idk but if y&#39;all are up for first time experience then go for it!

We walked in at 11:15 am. It is now 12:21 pm and we still don&#39;t have our food. There was hardly anyone here when we walked in so I&#39;m not sure what the problem is. Our server has been apologetic but geez.....I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be back.

The best meal I have ever had! My entire family agreed! That says a lot for my picky eaters. Was too full to have the cheesecake and that was the only reason we went haha.. service was very good we were seated very quickly. Wishing they would build one in my town!
It is a good place to dine with family . Friendly atmosphere. Good pasta . Fast order on working days .

There is usually a wait at this very popular family style restaurant alongside memorial city mall. The menu is extensive and most dishes we&#39;ve tried have been excellent. However the service can be really hit or miss. They seem to struggle when it gets busy. It can take over 30 - 40 minutes for food to arrive, then the orders don&#39;t always arrive in same time frame and some of the dishes were not hot enough. On a positive note everybody loved the cheesecake desert.

If I could give zero, I would. It took 2 hours for a happy hour burger. They were out of the gluten free bun I ordered, and the manager approached my table in a manner that implied it was our fault - saying hey, we run out of things and left it at that. Our orders finally came out- wrong- completely - our fries were not sweet potato or brought out with our burgers. Our to go cheesecake we ordered, came out on a plate, and I think it is HIGHLY unacceptable that the kitchen staff sits out front wearing a Cheescake Cake factory shirt and smokes. Not a fan of anything about this experience.

While the atmosphere and service was decent here- my tomato and chicken pasta was abysmal. The tomato sauce- advertised as creamy and rice in Tuscan spices- was more like tomato water. It ran through my noodles and pooled at the bottom of my bowl. And it was weird spicy... Almost too spicy to eat. There wasn&#39;t very much chicken, but it really seems like thin slices of chicken breasts that had been boiled and then had the tomato water poured over it. The noodles themselves were okay... there were way too many of them, and they didn&#39;t have any flavor but at least they were cooked al dente. <br>For almost a $15 entree, this was super disappointing.

30 minute wait to get a table, 20 mins to get water, another 5 to get bread after water, 20 to get food. We got there at 8:30 and didn&#39;t get our food until 9:40pm on a weeknight. <br><br>Don&#39;t waste your time. Go somewhere else. <br><br>And woman at front desk seemed like she was forced to stand there. Frowned face when people walked in.
It was cool. Typical Friday night craziness. We waited about 45 mins to be seated. Server was ok. I wasn&#39;t tripping because it was busy.

My girlfriend and I ate here on June 19th. We were greeted by a very rude hostess.  The table the hostess sat us at was dirty and the silverware and plates were also dirty.  It took the waiter almost ten minutes to even acknowledge​ us sitting at his table. We ordered our drinks and food.  I ordered the lunch pizza and house salad, and my girlfriend are a sandwich and soup of the day.  She was told the soup was French onion.  What came out was definitely not French onion.  They brought me out a Cesar salad.  I told them I had asked for a house salad with dressing on the side. Does Caesar Salad did not have dressing on it. When they finally brought out my house salad they put the dressing on top of it and brought me out sides of the wrong dressing. We ate our lunch and decided not even to have a cheesecake because we were just ready to leave the Cheesecake Factory.
Red Velvet Cheesecake - 10/10 - always a favorite of mine!<br><br>30th Anniversary Cheesecake - 8/10<br><br>Blueberry Mojito - 10/10 - very crisp and clean taste, yummmm!

The slowest service EVER. We came in with just 2 of us and we were there for over 2 hours. No alcoholic beverages. Just water and our entrees. Never experienced such slow service. We won&#39;t be back at this location. Save yourself some time and go to the Woodlands location.
Food was pretty good, but some guy tried to break into my finances car. Not impressed.

I came in here with my spouse the day before Valentines to spend Valentines day. We arrived to the place a little before closing maybe an hour... Our male server took our orders off paper and the service was fast the first time we received our order , but he did messed up our order not once but two times. The manager did come out to apologize the first time and fix the order but when the order came back several minutes later (leaving me to eat by myself) they brought the wrong order out! We notified the manager once again about it and he did take a couple of minutes to bring out our right order. And by the time his food got there I was already finishing my meal. My spouse felt disappointed because it was supposed to be our &#34;valentines date&#34; but we couldn&#39;t even eat our meal at the same time. As in for me I felt bad eating  by myself in front of him. We ended up leaving until after they closed the restaurant. It was NOT my first time here but it was in fact the worst experience.

DO NOT EAT HERE!<br>I am simply appalled by the behavior of ROB COWLE, the manager of this restaurant. Besides misinforming my group about the amount of time we would have to wait for a table, he was extremely disrespectful, passive aggressive, gratuitous, and rude. We have all seen staff at restaurants who do not know how to act professionally, especially in chain restaurants with weak customer service regulations, however, for a SENIOR MANAGER to act the way he did was gobsmacking and unexpected. Managers should act as an example for their staff and treat customers with politesse and respect, especially in this situation where we tried to be cordial with him. His behavior was so shocking we had to make a formal complaint with the company.<br>I advise everyone to avoid this this place if you have the opportunity to visit a more decent restaurant.

Meh. Came here for a work lunch - I did not pick the place. I was happy to see they had implemented a low cal menu, but you&#39;ll see how that turned out...<br><br>Pros:<br>Service - we had a large group and no one ever waited long for drink refills or food.<br>Guacamole - got the medium spice level and it was solid. The chips were soaked in grease though. <br><br>Cons:<br>Entree - got the pear and endive salad and it was awful. The portion was huge, but there was no point in it being that big because whatever was in the dressing was inedible! This may sound weird, but I couldn&#39;t tell what it was that was making it so harsh on the palette...I think it was salt but someone said they tasted raw celery or onion. It was just overwhelming. I had a few bites because I was hungry then I put my fork down because the whole thing was just soaked in this dressing. That&#39;s what I get for ordering off of the light menu I guess.<br><br>Luckily for them I don&#39;t normally come here so it&#39;s not like they lost a regular customer. Just remember to get dressing on the side if you get a salad.

Never Again!!!  I had the worst experience ever!!  The server &#34;Bianca&#34; was the worst server I have ever experienced. She was totally rude and condescending. After we were seated, we asked for bread. She responded: &#34;If you want bread, you gone have to wait for 10 minutes!&#34;  Twenty minutes everyone around us had bread, we had none.  After we ordered our food, she brought a fork and spoon without a knife for silverware. She finally brought the bread and butter. I had to ask a different server for a knife.  When we asked for drink refills, she said &#34;wait!&#34; in a harsh tone. I was ready to leave at this point but I hadn&#39;t eaten all day. When our food arrived, it was cold. I sent it back only to have to wait 10 minutes for it to return. I was done!!!  Never again for this Cheesecake Factory!!!!

Not too thrilled with my pick up order... Food seemed cold by the time I picked it up, despite saying I wanted the order to go in later, since I wouldn&#39;t be there in the estimated 20 minutes it took to make. Ordered the zucchini fries, and it didn&#39;t seem like a whole lot for the price and I didn&#39;t even get any bread, which the girl on the phone said I would get with the order. Probably won&#39;t be back to this location anytime soon.

This Cheesecake Factory location is well below the standards of the chain and subpar compared to other restaurants. We went on a slow Friday night and the restaurant wasn&#39;t clean at all. The floors were sticky, the tables weren&#39;t in good condition, and when we got ready to leave a baby roach started crawling up the booth where my friends were sitting. The women&#39;s bathrooms were deplorable with used feminine hygiene products out in the open and blood in the toilets unflushed. Clearly no one was tending to the restrooms. <br><br>Our waitress was fun but her mouth was too big. She looked at my friend who is of middle eastern decent and asked him if he was okay with the pork in the dish we ordered. I think she thought she was being helpful but that was a unwarranted and presumptuously racist comment. He had not specified that he had any dietary restrictions. <br><br>There was lots of confusion with our order apparently as several people came by asking what we had ordered. This was quite ridiculous because we only ordered two or three things. And the food and drinks came out slowly. Again, there weren&#39;t many people there. I tried to bring the issues to the manager&#39;s attention but he behaved as though couldn&#39;t care less. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this location at all.

Bad things: <br>1- Services was slow and not professional.
